story:
What is ARTISTA?

ARTISTA is a theatre program that is the first of its kind in Montreal. It will provide female youth with professional theatre training and mentorship for free. ARTISTA will connect young women, ages 16 – 21, to Montreal professional artists through training, mentorship and first-hand experience in creating theatre. 
Imago Theatre has been producing theatre in Montreal since 1987, making it one of Montreal's oldest English-language, independent theatre companies. ARTISTA is an extension of this mandate. 

ARTISTA’s Mandate:

To empower Montreal’s female youth and support them through the early stages of their careers, whatever those may be. Artistic independence and confidence, as well as increased knowledge in artistic craftsmanship, are acquired through mentorship, creative collaboration and performance training in a professional environment.




Your help will bring professional theatre training opportunities to female youth who wouldn't otherwise have access to our network and resources. 

Help us launch ARTISTA's inaugural year so that we can see this program flourish and grow in years to come!


ARTISTA's Amazing Staff

Our staff members are all talented professional artists who work in various fields of theatre in Montreal. We are excited to bring this awesome team of women together to share their talent with the next generation of female youth!




JOY ROSS-JONES - ARTISTA Program Coordinator
Actor, Puppet Performer, Acting Teacher

WARONA SETSHWAELO - ARTISTA Program Coordinator
Actor

STEFANIE BUXTON - ARTISTA Mentor
Actor, Voice Actor

ALEXANDRIA HABER - ARTISTA Mentor 
Playwright

DEENA AZIZ - ARTISTA Mentor
Actor, Dramaturge

ROSE PLOTEK - ARTISTA Mentor
Director

DELPHINE BIENVENU - ARTISTA Mentor
Actor

FRANCE ROLLAND - ARTISTA Mentor
Actor

JESSICA ABDALLAH - ARTISTA Mentor
Director, Teacher, Actor

JULIE TAMIKO MANNING - ARTISTA Mentor
Actor, Indie Theatre Producer, Playwright

JENNIFER ROBERTS -ARTISTA Mentor
Actor, Acting Teacher

MELANIE ST-JACQUES - ARTISTA Guest Artist
Stage Manager

ANANA RYDVALD - ARTISTA Guest Artist
Actor, Mask Performer

FELICIA SHULMAN - ARTISTA Guest Artist
Actor, Movement Teacher

AMANDA KELLOCK - ARTISTA Guest Artist
Actor, Director

LENI PARKER - ARTISTA GUEST ARTIST
Actor


By donating, you join us in breathing life into ARTISTA for the first time. 

Help us bring ARTISTA off the page and onto the stage.  




Imago Theatre produces thought-provoking works that reflect women's voices and stories of our time. We produce plays that address current issues and represent the female experience and perspective. We seek strong, unique voices and works with a social conscience. Our work transcends the cultural, linguistic and class barriers that hinder people's perceptions of each other. We give a voice to those who have become isolated, misunderstood or marginalized, either by including them in our operation activities our by putting their stories on stage. Imago also places the artist at the center of its work. We value creative freedom, provide opportunities for new partnerships and support the artistic process within a safe, healthy and professional environment. Through every Imago production, emerging or established artists are given the opportunity to learn and expand their practice.  


Our Space: The Georges-Vanier Cultural Centre

We have partnered with the Georges-Vanier Cultural Center in Little Burgundy to host ARTISTA's rehearsals as well as our workshop performance. 
The beautiful dance studio you see below will be our rehearsal hall during our 13-week program. We look forward to moving in and sharing our ARTISTA performance with the surrounding Little Burgundy community and greater Montreal audience. 


ARTISTA's History

ARTISTA did not just appear out of thin air. It was inspired by a youth mentorship program called The AMY Project, which is based in Toronto. The AMY Project, run by Claire Calnan and Weyni Mangesha, stands for "Artists Mentoring Youth." For the past nine years, AMY has been providing young women from the Greater Toronto Area with performance training, connections to artistic mentors, experience working in a professional theatre and support towards the early growth of their careers. ARTISTA is taking a page out of AMY's book and implementing their tried-and-true structure. 


We can't wait to provide this same formative experience to our ARTISTA participants!

Our Perks

For every level of donation, we have an associated perk labelled with the name of an inspiring woman. We encourage you to look them up and learn about their incredible accomplishments. There is no hierarchy when it comes to the importance of what they have contributed. In the same way that we appreciate every single donation, from $5.00 to $5,000, we appreciate their incredible accomplishments and effort in communities around the world.

story:
Meet Patti!

If you have been following Patti Drews, you know that this amazing lady is recovering nicely from her extensive back surgery that was performed in May. Patti is mobile and is getting ready to attend Union Theological Seminary in New York City this fall. Union is one of the most prestigious and progressive seminaries in the world, and, of course, they want Patti!

A Bit of History

Patti graduated from Western Washington University, Fairhaven College in June of 2011 with a degree in Social Advocacy, as well as minors in both Philosophy and Religion.  Patti had planned to work following her graduation from WWU.  Unfortunately, her acute back condition prevented her from using her education and moving back into the workforce. Her surgery, done at University of Washington Harborview Medical Center in Seattle WA, has an extended recovery period. She will be attending the Seminary for part of her first year as a disabled student.  All who know Patti know she has often held 2-3 jobs at a time, so her inability to work hard to reach her goals has been very challenging and humbling. 

Patti’s back problems were the result of a childhood accident. At age ten she fell through a barn loft and was seriously injured, resulting in a lifetime of pain and chronic health issues. This challenge coupled with being a single parent made Patti  very acquainted with struggle. Ironically it was also this misfortune that gave way to opportunity when an acute bout with her back prompted her to return to school. Patti’s own circumstances have fueled her passion for helping others in need, especially those who face misfortune or are disadvantaged. Everyone who knows Patti realizes how deeply she is affected by those in adverse situations. It is these incredible personal qualities, and her outstanding academic skills, that world renowned Union Theological Seminary found so worthy of awarding  admission and financial assistance.

Patti graduated from Western Washington University at age 48. Unfortunately her tremendous pain during this time precluded any type of celebration. Many of us who cheered her on were not even aware of her graduation until long after the event. We should celebrate, and acknowledge both that accomplishment as well as her acceptance into Union.

The Need

Although Patti, through diligent work, has received financial assistance, her upcoming additional costs will be extensive. One added expense would be her need for ongoing physical therapy during the recovery period. Additionally, due to her rehabilitation Patti needs a private studio apartment at Union. This necessary additional expense is not covered by her housing allowance and exceeds the allocated amount by nearly $200.00 per month.  Moving costs must also be considered. Together, as friends, family, and supporters of those worthy and willing to advance themselves, we can help Patti get to school and succeed! We all know Patti's success will result in service to others! Please join me by funding a great lady who has so very much to contribute!

Specifics

The following amounts are projections based on research into each category.

Moving Expenses (Shipping of personal items needed for Patti’s learning and daily living)                                                                           $ 500.00

Housing Costs not covered by Union  ($180 per month @ 10 months)

                                                                                    $1800.00

Columbia Student Medical Insurance Plan                 $4061.00

 Physical Therapy ($180 per month @6 months)       $1080.00

Total Need:    $ 7441.00

How You Can Help

Any amount you can spare will be greatly appreciated. This fundraiser is now on Indiegogo, and you can still contribute via PayPal by clicking here:


If that doesn't work, you can log in to PayPal and click "Send Money." Enter the email address lockwood4kids@frontier.com and the amount you wish to send. Mark the payment "Personal-Gift". Add “Go Patti, GO!” as your payment comment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can afford to contribute financially, you can also help by passing the word along to other friends and allies. The more exposure we get, the more likely we are to meet the goal. Check out the "share tools" at the top of this page, which will allow you to easily email, tweet, post to Facebook or embed a link to this campaign on your website. Please note: Indiegogo charges an additional 4% of the total funds raised if we meet the goal, and 9% if we don't. 

How Expenses Will Be Tracked

Campaign organizer Lisa Lockwood will record all contributions and ensure they are applied directly to Patti's educational, medical and moving expenses. In the event more money is raised than is needed, the additional funds will be will be applied first toward Indiegogo's fundraising fees, and then toward Patti's future student costs. 

Who Is Lisa Lockwood?

I am a public school teacher for the Ferndale School District. I first met Patti in 1989 when we both worked for a daycare in Bellingham. At that time her daughter was 2 and my daughter was 1. Patti and I have been friends for over 25 years. Throughout that time I have always been able to count on Patti for her ever-present listening ear, her many shared books, and her love of humanity. Please join me in helping Patti realize her life goals to serve others through her humanitarian commitment as she attends Union Theological Seminary. 

Please spread the news far and wide!
story_txt:
Meet Patti!
If
you have been following Patti Drews, you know that this amazing lady is
recovering nicely from her extensive back surgery that was performed in May.
Patti is mobile and is getting ready to attend Union Theological Seminary in
New York City this fall. Union is one of the most prestigious and progressive seminaries
in the world, and, of course, they want Patti!
A Bit of History
Patti
graduated from Western Washington University, Fairhaven College in June of 2011
with a degree in Social Advocacy, as well as minors in both Philosophy and
Religion.  Patti had planned to work following her
graduation from WWU. 
Unfortunately, her acute back condition prevented her from using her
education and moving back into the workforce. Her surgery, done at University of Washington
Harborview Medical Center in Seattle WA, has an extended recovery period. She
will be attending the Seminary for part of her first year as a disabled
student.  All who know Patti know she has
often held 2-3 jobs at a time, so her inability to work hard to reach her goals
has been very challenging and humbling.  
Patti’s back problems were the result of a
childhood accident. At age ten she fell through a barn loft and was seriously
injured, resulting in a lifetime of pain and chronic health issues. This challenge
coupled with being a single parent made Patti  very acquainted
with struggle. Ironically it was also this misfortune that gave way to
opportunity when an acute bout with her back prompted her to return to school. Patti’s own circumstances have fueled her passion for helping others
in need, especially those who face misfortune or are disadvantaged. Everyone
who knows Patti realizes how deeply she is affected by those in adverse
situations. It is
these incredible personal qualities, and her outstanding academic
skills, that world renowned Union Theological Seminary found so worthy of
awarding  admission and financial assistance.
Patti graduated from Western Washington University at age
48. Unfortunately her tremendous pain during this time precluded any type of
celebration. Many of us who cheered her on were not even aware of her
graduation until long after the event. We should celebrate, and acknowledge
both that accomplishment as well as her acceptance into Union. 
The Need
Although Patti, through diligent work, has received financial assistance, her upcoming additional costs
will be extensive. One added expense would be her need for ongoing physical
therapy during the recovery period. Additionally, due to her rehabilitation
Patti needs a private studio apartment at Union. This
necessary additional expense is not covered by her housing allowance and
exceeds the allocated amount by nearly $200.00 per month.  Moving costs must also be considered. Together,

500.00
Housing Costs not covered by Union  ($180 per month @ 10 months)
                                                                                    $1800.00

story:
Hello Change Makers !!

Yes ,YOU all are The Change Makers as YOUR Help will help my kids to get close to their dreams and give them the HOPE that they can be achieved. 

I am Hemanth Janagama, Fellow at Teach for India, The Indian Version of Teach for All Network. I work in a low income private school in Hyderabad city where I teach 30 Super Sharp Amazing 3rd Grade Kiddos called THE AMAZERS. I completed my graduation in 2012 and Joined Teach for India to Bridge the Inequity gap of education between the rich and the underprivileged.

In the process I learnt many things from my Amazers which helped me grow as a Leader.


What YOU can DO :)

All you have to do is Donate some money to my class as i want to do the following the things for my Kids this year.

1. Buy a Projector to help digitize their learning.

2. Take them to multiple places to give them the exposure that motivates them to study hard and achieve their dreams.

3. Conduct workshops in different areas which my kids are interested in such as Photography, Film making, Painting by getting professionals to the class and train my kids with their expertise with all the perfect materials.

4. Last but not least, To build a Library for my kids with the worlds best books to make them The Best Readers.


The Impact :)


Being deprived of all these resources, My Amazers are showing remarkable growth in terms of academics and character. Your donation will add fuel to their fire and will make them believe that there are people who help them to achieve their dreams and dreams are not confined to the students in high standard schools.

Other Ways You Can Help


Spread the campaign to your family and friends and ask them to Donate :)

YOUR DONATION WILL ACHIEVE THEIR AMBITION :) !!!!

Thank You All :) !!!

story:
Our Mission

    Willow Roots’ mission is to cultivate a safe community of inspired learners through a curiosity-driven and project-based learning approach. Our focus is to inspire our children to acknowledge and embrace their self-worth and to empower students to become responsible, creative and critical thinkers, while nurturing empathy and emotional intelligence.

     We’re also committed to inspiring a life-long dedication to environmental stewardship. In our natural learning environments, our students learn the connection of all life and how our actions influence the world around us.

 

With Your Help

    We are so very excited to have the opportunity to serve children through a different option for education in our community. We need YOUR help and would be so very grateful for any amount of monetary gift to be applied to start up fees, first year salary assistance for experienced, innovative teachers, and a space for our school.


For Your Gift

Any Monetary Gift:

- A big THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts!

 

A Gift of $150:

- Private Tour: We’d love to invite you to take a  tour of our facility in exchange for your donation. You will be one of the first to see the building before opening our doors!

 

A Gift of $250:

- Priority Enrollment: Guarantee your child’s spot at Willow Roots this upcoming school year. You will receive the enrollment application before the general public, and your child’s name will be put at the top of the list. 

- Private Tour

 

A Gift of $500:

- Permanent Recognition on the Donor Board: We'd love to have your name or business on our permanent donor board place in the school!

- Priority Enrollment

- Private Tour

 

A Gift of $750: 

- 5% off first year tuition for your student!

- Permanent Recognition on the Donor Board

- Priority Enrollment

- Private Tour

 

A Gift of $1000 or more:

- Permanent Recognition on the Donor Board (large): We'd love to have your name or business on our permanent donor board place in the school!

- 5% off first year tuition for your student!

- Permanent Recognition on the Donor Board

- Priority Enrollment

- Private Tour

story:
Why I Want To Study In Germany

Hello, my name is Casey Paulus, I'm a senior at Theodore Roosevelt high school and I have a passion for German.

I traveled to Germany for our school's German-American exchange, for a month last summer with my class. A month in Germany didn't feel long enough! Through this trip we traveled across Germany, attended school and lived with a host family for three weeks, experiencing real German culture. The time that I spent in Germany was unforgettable! But there was one thing that bugged me the entire time I was in Germany and that was that I'm not fluent in the language. My desire is to be able to study abroad for a year in Germany and become fluent. My ultimate long term goal is to live and work in Germany!  

What We Need & What You Get

The money that is made from this video will be used to cover my expenses for the organization, my plane ticket and medical insurance.

For helping me reach my goal, I would like to send you a variety of German goods! Anything from postcards to candies!

 

The Impact

From the moment I returned from the exchange, it was my goal to somehow go back to Germany, become fluent in German and eventually live in Germany. Because of the exchange that I was in, my exchange partner and I became best friends! We've promised each other that we would see each other again but next time, my German would be better. Saying goodbye to her and her family was the toughest goodbye I've ever had to make. Throughout my senior year, I've dedicated my time to studying Geman, I even became the Vice-President of our school's German club! I have also become very close with my German teacher and she recommended that I take part in a GAP Year and study abroad! 

I'm determined to make this goal of studying abroad! Once I return I plan to attend college and major in either graphic design or Global studies and minor in German!

Other Ways You Can Help If You're Unable To Donate

1.Share this campaign on you Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, ect.

2. Send this campaign link via email to all of your contacts.

3. Perhaps you know someone who would donate like a family member, friend, co-worker or even neighbor.

story:
Julieta will be giving a talk at LASA as a part of two interdisciplinary panels organized on Decolonial Feminisms: Theory and Practice.

She received a $1000 scholarship from LASA in support of her participation, but the average roundtrip plane fare from La Paz to DC is closer to $2000, not to mention the food costs and hotel costs while she is here.

Obviously those of us who can will supplement hotel rooms, but, at a minimum, we still must raise funds to cover her plane fare. 

Because LASA is occurring after the academic school year has closed, we cannot get funds from universities in the DC area via the scheduling of additional talks. This has therefore made fundraising quite difficult. 

We have contacted various NGOS in the DC area to no avail, and so we are now hoping that through your generosity, we can collectively raise enough money to facilitate her participation. 

Please consider making a small contribution to support this very important intellectual and activist work!

We cannot decolonize feminism if decolonial feminist thinkers are not present at these types of events!

story:
Fund a Nicaraguan Medical student, Wendy Rodriguez! 

Hello!  My name is Wendy Ingram and I have recently returned from a medical mission trip to Jiquilillo, Nicaragua with the Arizona-based group H.E.R.O. (Humanitarian Efforts Reaching Out).  Jiquilillo is a small rural village near a protected estuary with more than 20 small villages surrounding it.  HERO has now completed two medical missions providing desperately needed medical, dental, and veterinary care in 2013 and 2014.  Each time we have gone, there have been a number of passionate Nicaraguan medical students who have taken it upon themselves to join us in providing care to these under-served communities.  Without these students’ dedication, translation, and rapport with the local communities, HERO would have an incredibly hard time.  This year we were lucky enough to have seven outstanding 3rd year Medical students from Leon, Nicaragua join us.  Their maturity, consideration, and passion for medicine was integral to our mission, not to mention inspiring to see in the local doctors of tomorrow. 

Unfortunately, not all of these incredible medical students can afford to be full time students, and some are even supporting their families at the same time.  It would be a tragedy if these promising young students had to give up their dreams to be doctors.  We at HERO have decided to support as many of these students as we can who show commitment to their studies, passion for medicine, and a dedication to continuing to serve rural, impoverished communities in Nicaragua.  Please help us in supporting one of these fantastic students, Wendy Rodriguez. 

Medical School tuition is only $3000 a year.  Any amount you can contribute to this worthy cause will be greatly appreciated!  Together, we can make sure that Nicaraguan students, dedicated to providing services to rural populations, can learn medicine and bring the much needed regular care to the communities that need it most. 

HERO thanks you!

One of the most gratifying aspects of providing care to these communities is seeing the smiles on the faces of the Nicaraguan people.  Many of the communities we visited these last two years had never received medical care before.  Our doctors, nurses, and dentists addressed illnesses and injuries that had been suffered with for years, or even decades.  Photographs of our North American and Nicaraguan team at work, face to face with the men, women, and children of these communities are heart-wrenchingly beautiful.  We will print and mail you a stunning photo from one of our trips if you pledge $20 or more.

Even if you can't contribute financially, please share our campaign on your social networks so that we can provide support to these incredible medical students.

story:
What is The Ubuntu Project? 

• Ubuntu is a belief in a  universal bond of sharing that connects all humanity. 

•A group of friends & organizations have come together to raise $2000 for back-to-school supplies to give to the 30 youth of Garland Hall. 

•Returning back to school in the fall, embarking on new classes, teachers, classmates & curricula is such an important time for any student. The Garland Hall students are all returning to classes on September 1, 2014. We're making sure they're prepared. 

•It costs $50 to sponsor each child. 


Garland Hall Memorial Children's Home 

• Garland Hall is a orphanage located 15 min away from Montego Bay, Jamaica. 

• The home offers a home to 30 youth ranged in age from 9-16 years old. 

• The Orphanage is located across the street from Anchovy High School. They use same to very similar school supplies as students in the states. We'll be sending them: 

• They have 3 dormitories, one for the older girls, one for the younger girls and a boys’ dorm. Each of them can be used by up to 10 youth at a time.

• The facility the children live in was originally a private home that belonged to Elisabeth Garland Hall (1867 – 1933). Who herself was orphaned very early and amongst many other activities decided to run an orphanage in her own private home. 

Who's Behind the Project 

Dream Defenders, Hands That Love, Inc. friends and family have all come together to make The Ubuntu Project materialize to this point. We believe the universal bond ubuntu signifies to be a reality. To create all the change we want to see in the world this is a belief that we want to cultivate and share pass nationalities, race, gender, etc. For many of us participating in The Ubuntu Project, we know Jamaica to be home and believe in the islands motto: Out of Many, One People.

Jamaica, Jamaica, Jamaica land we love.  

Share This Campaign w/ Your Network

story:
Our non-profit organization is Why Help Others. We want to raise awareness for ALL the causes there are in today's world. One way we want to do this is by producing a convention & expo/fair for 100 non-profits organizations across the U.S.. The expo/fair will be open to the public and the property we have chosen can accommodate up to 10,000 guests in one event day. Our goal for event day is Fri, Sept 5th, 2014, but we are running out of time!!!

Please watch the short slideshow we created. In less than 3 minutes, we were able to expose 34 disturbing statistics that deal with 19 of today’s issues around the U.S. alone.


Imagine what we can do in an entire day…

Thank you again for all your support and considering a contribution to our campaign.


Our mission is to raise awareness & encourage people to find a cause that speaks to them.


This is only a small sample of what we are coordinating. In addition to below, we will have raffles, door buster prizes, etc.

Our plan is to set-up the fair like a theme park, with a map and a schedule of events “around the park”.


Offering the public:

  • A fun-to-browse expo showcasing a wide variety of non-profits and their cause(s)

  • Door buster giveaways & raffles

  • Recycled designer-jeans auction & jean drive
    (bring in your old blue jeans for credit towards live auction)

  • Take-home souvenir bags filled with free stuff & useful information on local resources

  • Sign-ups for volunteer opportunities

  • Fingerprinting & safety kits for kids 12 and under

  • Earth-friendly arts & crafts (homemade bird feeders, non-toxic art)

  • Live music

  • Inspirational keynotes by 5-star Motivational Speaker & Certified Life Coach

  • Blood mobile on site

  • Benefit dinner & party

  • Shirley Temple bar

  • And more!

We have two main goals with this event:
1. For the non-profit organizations to network, gain a wealth of resources and be inspired with fresh ideas to help their unique cause(s).
2. Engage the community through interactive activities while browsing the causes and raising awareness through education in a fun, memorable way.


We have over 65 fundraising opportunities throughout the day which we are calling "donation stations". (Games, raffles, auctions, bake-less bake sale, pet pictures, meaningful micro tattoos, balloon pop, pin on map treasure hunt, feather pull, selfie contest, doggie wash & dry, Shirley Temple bar, and a lot more...). We also have space for approximately 100 expo booths for the non-profit organizations to showcase their cause(s).

For example, Doggie wash & dry: we have volunteers (local professionals) to bathe the dogs, and we have donations of grooming mobiles for the doggie dryers. We can get donations of dog shampoo & conditioner so this "donation station" costs $0 to produce and we will raise at least $900.

We also have a Benefit Dinner scheduled on the evening of expo that is expected to raise $22,500 minimum after a cost of $4,500 to coordinate.


A few more examples:

No-minimum-monopoly-money donations:
At the door, expo guests will be given two $1’s (play money). After they browse, they will give the $1’s to the cause(s) of their choice. At the end of the day, organizations will turn in their play currency for a real donation check to take home to their charity. No minimum required.

Pet Pictures booth
*take some pet pics after pucci is all pretty from his or her wash & dry 
Bake-less bake sale 
*baking mixes you finish at home
Meaningful micro tattoos 
*several micro designs to choose from for animal lovers, tree huggers, increase the peace, cruelty-free bunny symbol, etc.


They will also gain exposure to two types of corporate donors: top responsible businesses that build corporate donations into their business models and not-so-green companies seeking ways to offset the carbon footprint of their business practices. 


We will also be inviting the tri-country school boards to do a field trip to our event. We will only be able to schedule a maximum of 24 schools of 33 students each, scheduled throughout the day. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


We have already done all the research - these are our major costs:  
Venue - hotel rooms, meals on site, expo/fair meeting space
Booth displays - most eco-friendly & economical options
Speaker for event & motivational morning following day of expo (team building games, industry secret sharing, pep rally, etc.).

$139 x 298 rooms = $41,442
$850 x 100 HOPUP booth displays = $85,000
(they get to keep and re-use!)
on-site meals for 2 days = $65,000
(including the benefit dinner cost)
One 5-star motivational speaker = $5,000
(speaking at event & next day during morning of motivation) 


The typical cost of a trade show booth ranges from $800-$3,500 for display equipment rental only. Then additional sponsorship dues can range from $10,000 - $100,000 to participate in a trade show event or convention. Due to the nature of being entirely non-profit 501(c) organizations, we’ve worked very hard to keep the cost as low as possible in order to encourage high participation levels. The display components for the booth/table are to take home and re-use (they fold up in under 5 min and cost about $40 to ship anywhere domestically). Taxes have already been waived as well. 


The following morning on 09/06, we are hosting a Morning of Motivation with a 5-star motivational speaker and certified life coach. We will watch a handful of short films, play some team building games and have a pep rally! This is one way we want to thank the non-profits for participating in and believing in our first expo/fair. We want them to leave with a wealth of resources and fresh ideas to help their unique cause(s), all while making friends in the likeness of bettering the world. After a morning of thought-provoking fun, we have coordinated some group tours for them to enjoy the various beauties around South FL (for a nominal fee). This portion of the convention is not open to the public.

“Movies alone can’t change the world, but the people who watch them can.” – Jehane Noujaim



We have coordinated everything. However, we do not have the capital for the venue, and the costs associated with producing an expo/fair (the bulk listed above). The funding would allow us to reserve the venue for the event, offer hotel to out-of-state organizations (they would still be responsible for travel to the venue located in Fort Lauderdale, FL), and pay for the display units and costs of the fundraising "donation stations" we have created.


The average cost is $1964 per organization for everything included for 3 representatives to attend. However, even with all the exposure and opportunity we are offering, most have endured challenges and  resistance due to strict budgets. So, now we are seeking corporate donations and crowd funding to help us get this done.

We set up the campaign so Why Help Others will receive the funds even in the event we do not reach the full funding goal. This way, we will be able to offer a space at the event for no cost, or very little cost, to the first 100+ non-profits available to participate.  

We can accommodate up to 125-135 causes if we exceed our budget. 

Our main reward is increasing awareness/education, encouraging prevention and getting the public actively engaged in their community. However, we have the potential to raise over $100,000 right at the event which will be given directly to the organizations to benefit their cause(s). 

Please help us spread the word!

If 9,822 people donate $20 each (or 1,964 people donate $100 each), we will reach our funding goal!!

Every $1 counts. 

However, if you are unable to contribute monetarily at this time, will you please #repost and help us spread the word so we can make this happen? We are also seeking corporate donations, where possible. Your contributions are tax-deductible. 


Thank you,

Sarah Elizabeth &
The Why Help Others Team

story:
My name is Dennis Mixer. 
I am an ordained minister and founder of Ministry of the Sheep International
I am also a U.S. Army vet, a veteran of Desert Storm and was a Police Officer & Emergency Medical Technician in Missouri for 17 years.   
In 2007, After years in Law enforcement, God called me into ministry.  Since that time I have spent six months working at an orphanage in Honduras, Started Ministry of the Sheep, did a 4,000 mile Journey of faith, ministered to poor, homeless and desolate on the streets of Atlanta, GA and, for the past 3 1/2 years, cared for my mother who has Alzheimer's.  All of this has been done on faith.  As the current season seems to be coming to an end, I feel that God is leading me to begin training young people for ministry and missions by partnering with Youth With a Mission(YWAM).
In order to partner with YWAM, I must first go through their basic Discipleship Training School and I must also be self-supported. 
I also mentor a young man, Nebojsa Dusanic, who desires to attend the Discipleship Training.  Nebojsa was born in Germany and has a heart for spreading the Gospel in Germany.  For this reason we have chosen the YWAM school in Hurlach, Germany which starts in September of this year. 

What We Need

  • Attending the YWAM discipleship School will cost the two of us about $15,000.  This includes the six month school, room & board, transportation, a missions trip during the school and about $50.00 a month each for unplanned expenses.
  • Ideally, Nebojsa and I will be able to attend the school together; I believe that is God's will,  however, it is my priority that Nebojsa get trained for ministry.  In the event that we do not raise all the funds needed for both of us, Nebojsa will attend the class starting this fall.  Any funds left will be set aside while I continue to raise enough for me to enter a different class.  
  • Any funds over and above what is needed for the school will be used to support us in future ministry endeavors, as EVERYONE in YWAM must obtain their own support. 

What You Get

  • I am in the process of doing a final edit on my book, "No Mere Coincidences, a journey of faith"  an account of my 4,000 mile journey where I traveled from Minneapolis to Washington DC to Florida and then to Peoria, IL--- totally on faith, ministering to anyone God put in my path; asking for nothing but water to drink and a place to set my tent at night. 
  • for all donations over $25.00 I will email a pre-published, PDF copy of the book.

The Impact

  • Imagine: getting to Heaven and having people that you never met coming to you, thanking you for your part in them getting to heaven.  When you donate to get us to YWAM school, YOU have a part in every person we reach with the gospel.  For every young person I train because of you, YOU have a part in every person they reach for Christ.
  • Imagine: someone that is reached with the gospel, because YOU donated, became the next great evangelist, leading thousands to Christ.
  • Imagine, churches, orphanages, feeding centers...being started by someone who was reached with the Gospel by someone that was reached by someone WE ministered to, because YOU donated.
  • Donating to get us to YWAM school doesn't just have a six month effect, it will have an Impact for eternity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Pray for us!  Pray that we raise the funds we need.  Pray that God will work in our lives and that we be vessels, pouring out the Holy Spirit where ever we go.
  • Make some noise about our campaign!  Use the share tools to spread word to your friends, family and churches.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools too!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Grow Out! Summer Day Camp

             ....To Live is To Learn....

We're excited to announce the beginning of Fairfield's newest summer camp! 

Grow Out Summer Camp will be an adventurous weekly camp this Summer, with a focus on the outdoors and nature connection. Children will be growing a community garden, tracking animals through the woods, identifying birds, and making all sorts of crafts. Did I forget to mention games and activities? We'll be having more fun than a barrel of baboons!

---------

Nature-Connection

With more and more kids accustomed to sitting in front of their TVs and Computer Screens, it's time we as community uncover more opportunities for our kids to learn outdoors. 

There is an almost endless resource of fun and exciting things to do when you step out your door, especially in groups, and we're going to inspire our campers to want to be out and explore all the live-long day. Granted, some days the weather may be too hot or stuffy to be out all day, so we have backup plans with arts & crafts in our classroom to continue the fun. All of our activities will be fun, inspiring, and doable.

----------

Food Insecurity in Iowa

  • 19% of children in Iowa are considered Food Insecure
  • 1 in 5 Iowa children do not have enough to eat.
  • 395,620 Iowans live at or below the poverty line
  • Studies have shown that food insecurity negatively impacts cognitive development of children, and causes poorer school performance.

Teaching our children to appreciate growing their own food will not only give them more abundance in their lives, it will also increase their performance in schools and lead to more positive and secure lifestyles.

----------

Your Contributions will support making Grow Out! Summer Camp possible!

We currently are in the planning phases for camp and we clearly are in over our heads in costs in a number of areas...

  • Liability Insurance
  • Gardening Equipment
  • Classroom Materials
  • Advertising Costs
  • Utilities Cost
  • Scholarships to allow campers with low-income to join

With your generous donation, you will help us get a smooth start for campers this year, and get us on the road to Nature Connection! Thank you!


Christina Hoffman [one of the future counselors] and her hand-woven Infinity Scarves!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                               Our Facebook Page!

       

https://www.facebook.com/growoutsummercamp

davey.bar@gmail.com

(530)-563-6669

story:
Lone Star Mensa's 16th Annual Convention

With hotels now requiring catering, and us trying to get more people to come enjoy our annual convention, we have to increase our seed budget.  We are also hoping to really build up our kid's programs and raise more money for college scholarships. 

More information on the LoneStaRG event itself - including history, scheduled events and presenters, please go to http://lonestarg.com/ and see what our event is all about! 

What We Need 

Some upgrades we would like to make to our event, and why:

  • We are hoping to have a lot more kid's activities this year. We are trying to raise  at least $1000.00 to create kid's room supply kits that we can use from year to year and re-furbish supplies as needed.  We are working with an area children's librarian from Austin Public Library on how they set up their kits and what is most popular.  We would like to make some craft kits (perler beads, general art kits, simple jewelry making kits, rock painting kits, Altoid tin crafts, etc) along with some fun science experiment kits (polymer science type kits: slime & kinetic sand making, solar and wind power kits, solar system demonstration kit, and more like from STEVE SPANGLER SCIENCE)  and games (paper roller coaster building, general good kid's games.) We have willing people to host the events, but a very tiny budget to devote to the kid's activities. 

What You Get

  • We have different levels of business sponsorship perks, as well as other perks!
  • Some perks are registration packages with or without a hotel option.  Come join us for the festivities! 
  • Exchange printing services for advertising (scroll down for examples) 
                       email howdylsm@gmail.com if you are interested
  • Also we have set it up where you can support very specific kid's activity goals - for example: We would really like, for Kid's activities, a "Larry's Lab Polymer Science Kit" for $49.99 + Shipping.  You can sponsor this particular gift, and we will put your name (and business link if applicable) on our LoneStaRG.com website under the kit you sponsored for our event, along with photos from kid's using the kit at the Regional Gathering!  (scroll down for specific kid's activity item details!)
Example of supporting a specific goal:

     


    What happens if we don't reach the entire goal?

    We will use what we can and make cuts where we need to:

    • Then we would trim the kid's activity budget as much as we can
    Supporting LoneStaRG Impact

    • Basically, we are upgrading our annual social convention to have more fun for all, have an awesome fundraiser for college scholarships, have interesting and structured activities for the kids, and provide our presenters with a great experience.  We want to add some things to attract Gen Y crowds - because we believe Gen Y and beyond is our future.  
    • This is our 16th annual gathering for the Lone Star Mensa group.  People come from other Texas and national Mensa groups to attend, 
    • All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.  Plus, our "play" is often pretty educational and builds creative thinking and social situations for a group of Mensa folks! Join us! How to Join Mensa 

    Risks & Challenges

    We have been operating on a smaller budget for years, and we may not be able to offer as much as we had in previous years due to catering requirements and such. 

    We would really like to be able to attract more people, have more activities for children, etc... but we may need to make these changes a little at a time as we can. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Feel free to send our campaign link to your friends, our event link to your friends, or tell people how they can join Mensa! 

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign!
    • Think they would like to learn more about joining Mensa? Send them this link: How to Join Mensa 
    • Not only are we having this social event, we also need vendors for our vendor market!  Do you know anyone in the Central Texas Area that may have something they would like to sell/promote in our Geek Market (open to the public)?  Send them this link: http://lonestarg.com/vendors.html
    • To learn more information on the LoneStaRG event itself - including history, scheduled events and presenters, please go to http://lonestarg.com/ and see what our event is all about! 
    • If you are in Central Texas and interested in possibly attending some Lone Star Mensa events to see if you would like to join yourself - see our calendar for events open to the public (monthly games nights, presentations and more!) http://www.lonestar.us.mensa.org/calendar.html

    Some of the business sponsorship packages:

    BRONZE SPONSORSHIP: $100.00 - $199.99

    What you get:

    · A link and image/logo on our “Links” and “Sponsors” pages

story_txt:
Lone Star Mensa's 16th Annual Convention With hotels now requiring catering, and us trying to get more people to come enjoy our annual convention, we have to increase our seed budget.  We are also hoping to really build up our kid's programs and raise more money for college scholarships. 
More information on the LoneStaRG event itself - including history, scheduled events and presenters, please go to http://lonestarg.com/ and see what our event is all about!    What We Need  Some upgrades we would like to make to our event, and why:


We are hoping to have a lot more kid's activities this year. We are trying to raise  at least $1000.00 to create kid's room supply kits that we can use from year to year and re-furbish supplies as needed.  We are working with an area children's librarian from Austin Public Library on how they set up their kits and what is most popular.  We would like to make some craft kits (perler beads, general art kits, simple jewelry making kits, rock painting kits, Altoid tin crafts, etc) along with some fun science experiment kits (polymer science type kits: slime & kinetic sand making, solar and wind power kits, solar system demonstration kit, and more like from STEVE SPANGLER SCIENCE)  and games (paper roller coaster building, general good kid's games.) We have willing people to host the events, but a very tiny budget to devote to the kid's activities. 

What You Get

We have different levels of business sponsorship perks, as well as other perks!
Some perks are registration packages with or without a hotel option.  Come join us for the festivities! 
Exchange printing services for advertising (scroll down for examples) 


                       email howdylsm@gmail.com if you are interested
Also we have set it up where you can support very specific kid's activity goals - for example: We would really like, for Kid's activities, a "Larry's Lab Polymer Science Kit" for $49.99 + Shipping.  You can sponsor this particular gift, and we will put your name (and business link if applicable) on our LoneStaRG.com website under the kit you sponsored for our event, along with photos from kid's using the kit at the Regional Gathering!  (scroll down for specific kid's activity item details!)


Example of supporting a specific goal:

 




What happens if we don't reach the entire goal?
We will use what we can and make cuts where we need to:

Then we would trim the kid's activity budget as much as we can

Supporting LoneStaRG Impact 
Basically, we are upgrading our annual social convention to have more fun for all, have an awesome fundraiser for college scholarships, have interesting and structured activities for the kids, and provide our presenters with a great experience.  We want to add some things to attract Gen Y crowds - because we believe Gen Y and beyond is our future.   This is our 16th annual gathering for the Lone Star Mensa group.  People come from other Texas and national Mensa groups to attend,  All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.  Plus, our "play" is often pretty educational and builds creative thinking and social situations for a group of Mensa folks! Join us! How to Join Mensa  
  Risks & Challenges We have been operating on a smaller budget for years, and we may not be able to offer as much as we had in previous years due to catering requirements and such. 
We would really like to be able to attract more people, have more activities for children, etc... but we may need to make these changes a little at a time as we can. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Feel free to send our campaign link to your friends, our event link to your friends, or tell people how they can join Mensa!  
Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign! Think they would like to learn more about joining Mensa? Send them this link: How to Join Mensa 
Not only are we having this social event, we also need vendors for our vendor market!  Do you know anyone in the Central Texas Area that may have something they would like to sell/promote in our Geek Market (open to the public)?  Send them this link: http://lonestarg.com/vendors.html

To learn more information on the LoneStaRG event itself - including history, scheduled events and presenters, please go to http://lonestarg.com/ and see what our event is all about! 

If you are in Central Texas and interested in possibly attending some Lone Star Mensa events to see if you would like to join yourself - see our calendar for events open to the public (monthly games nights, presentations and more!) http://www.lonestar.us.mensa.org/calendar.html

story:
Dear Friends,

I recently obtained my teaching credential for the state of California and my Master's of Education. I am a new teacher and just got hired to teach 3rd grade this coming August! I could not be more thrilled. I am working at Title I school, where all of my 25 future students are on free breakfast in the classroom and free lunch. They come from very diverse backgrounds. My classroom for the year is in a trailer near the cafeteria. We have desks and chairs for the students but we could use your donations to help gain supplies to help us learn and succeed for the year! Being a new teacher, I am transforming this classroom from nothing to something, and with your help, we can access and utilize these supplies for reading, writing, art, English language development, science, P.E, music, math, and social studies. Help us learn and grow! 
A detailed supply and price list is below (at the end of this paragraph). These are the supplies I've found that will help us in what we want to learn for this year. It stems from the basics: pencils and hand sanitizer, to folders that will help the students organize their homework for the year.  If you are unable to donate, you can still help by sharing this campaign with others. Also, feel free to donate supplies that you may have sitting around the house! These basic necessities will provide so much to these students in need. You will not only be helping the students write, draw and solve problems for the year, but also changing lives by supporting these students on their journey as lifelong learners. 

    Warmest Regards

story:
Our Mission

As kids, many of us were fortunate enough to enjoy a nice playground where we could play with our childhood friends. Many of us have fond childhood memories of spending time at the playground, and we hope to ensure that the children of Cleveland, Tennessee can also have a great place to make memories. The town of Cleveland, Tennessee currently has a playground at its community center where the children of the town can play, but it is in need of some improvements and new equipment.

As a student-led group from the University of Tennessee, our team embodies the term "Volunteer," and because of this, we aim to assist this community by raising the money to help them upgrade their community playground. With your donations, this community will be able to purchase quality, up-to-date playground equipment for their community playground.

       



What We Need & What You Get

Our minimum goal is to raise $1,100, however there is an emphasis on minimum. We would love to exceed our goal so we can contribute as much as we can to the improvement of this playground!

The $1,100 that we are raising will fund the purchase of baby seats for the swing set, the purchase of mulch to level out the playground area, and the construction of a school bus stop beside the playground for the children. No matter if we meet our financial goal or not, all funds raised will go toward the improvement of this park.

By donating, you will have the personal satisfaction of contributing to the lives of others, but you will also earn perks with your donation, depending on your donation amount. Who could pass up this opportunity?!


  Tier 1 Perk:

If you donate $1 or more, we will give you a shout-out on our campaign social media pages!


Tier 2 Perk:

If you donate $5 or more, we will email you a Renovate Blythe Park computer wallpaper so you can show your support for our campaign! All previous tiers are included.


Tier 3 Perk:

If you donate $25 or more, you will receive a personalized thank you note from our team! All previous tiers are included.

Tier 4 Perk:

If you donate $50 or more, you will receive a UT Vols gift package which includes UT-themed items such as a tote bag, a lanyard, a pen, a folder, and a bookmark! All previous tiers are included.


The Impact

We want to be able to fund the improvements of this community gathering place so the people of Cleveland have a nice place for their families to meet and enjoy themselves. These improvements will not only add more features to the playground, but leveling out the terrain will also make the playground a better place for the children to play. We want to know that we were able to put a smile on a child's face, even through something as small as buying some mulch or building a bus stop. Also, it is always a great feeling to know that you have  been a part of something that helped positively affect the lives of others. Any form of contribution is accepted and appreciated, and it is all going toward a great cause!

       



 Risks & Challenges

Since we are simply raising money for this town to improve their community playground, there really aren't many risks involved with this campaign. The main risk that we face is the possibility of not raising enough money to meet our goal. If we don’t meet our project goal, the money will still be donated to the people of Cleveland so they can use it to buy playground equipment when they gather the remainder of the needed funds. Our team is dedicated to making this fundraiser a success.


Other Ways You Can Help

For those who cannot give there are still ways you can help! One of the biggest and easiest ways to contribute is by simply spreading the word, whether it be word-of-mouth or through social media. Every bit of effort is appreciated!



The Renovate Blythe Park group is in association with:


Media credits:

  -- Video Music: Frannie (Instrumental Version) (Josh Woodward) / CC BY 4.0 (Unedited)
  -- Perk Icons: Flat UI Icons (Designmodo) / CC BY 3.0 (Modified)

story:
Short Summary

The JUMP! Project (Just Us Moms Performing) is a nine-month project to empower young single moms to conceptualize, write, and produce a theatrical piece that tells their own stories. Throughout the project, a film crew is documenting the people, the project, and the process.

Through performances and the documentary, these young moms can control their own narrative as well as challenge the mainstream social and political views of what it means to be a young single mom.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to cover costs for workshop, theater, and film production costs, and paying the artists and moms for all their hard work. Because this project is nine months long, we're setting monthly goals to help us get there.

To keep things going, we need to raise $5,000 in December to cover equipment costs that the project has already incurred.

We want to recognize all levels of support:

  • $25 & up - your name listed on the web site as a supporter
  • $100 & up - your name listed in the end credits of the documentary as a supporter
  • $250 & up - your name listed on the playbill as a supporter
  • $500 & up - two free tickets to the show
  • $1,000 - your name listed as a project sponsor on all promotional materials
  • $5,000 & up - your name listed as a producer on the documentary

The Impact

The phrase “welfare mom” evokes images of lazy, uneducated, loose women who are bent on having as many babies as they can to “milk the system.” In reality, many cannot afford the milk they need to feed their children.

In Kentucky, unmarried mothers are required to volunteer or work 20 hours per week and be enrolled in school in order to have access to Kentucky Transitional Assistance Program and childcare assistance. Recent budget cuts left 15,000 families in Kentucky without the childcare assistance that they depend on. The work requirement for childcare assistance leaves many young moms struggling to graduate from high school on time; when they lose eligibility for childcare assistance at 20, it endangers their ability to complete their education.

With all of the stresses of being a student, a worker, and a single mom, there is too often not enough time for these young moms to be creative, and so their stories are silenced. Historically, this has been a literal silence, as the girls who “got into trouble” were sent away to hide a shameful secret from the community. But there continues a metaphorical silence, as outsiders from the media impose a narrative on these young moms’ lives rather than tell the truth of their experiences.

The JUMP! Project will end this silence.


Challenges

Making a documentary is time-consuming and expensive. The start-up costs have been well into the thousands, and production costs are much, much higher.

Theater production is also expensive, not only for the space, but also for the technical support and insurance.

The moms and artists are spending many hours each month to make this project happen. Artists should be paid a fair wage for their work.


Other Ways You Can Help

No matter where you live, please share our project with your social media circles using the Indiegogo share tools. You can also share your words of encouragement on Indiegogo, our web site, twitter, or Facebook.

If you're local:
  • Make donations for the workshops and rehearsals, like snacks and drinks for the kids (we provide childcare), gas cards, bus tickets, art supplies, or pens.
  • Purchase a wish list item from our list on Pinterest. You can send or drop off items at Step by Step. Be sure to mention that your donation is for the JUMP! Project.
  • Volunteer. We can use a few volunteers for childcare, giving rides to the moms, and later on, to help with the theater performances.
  • Next May, attend a performance, buy a t-shirt, or buy a DVD. Proceeds will go to Step By Step, and used to fund future projects to empower these moms.

story:
Short Summary

On March 12th, 2015 Minnesota Internship Center (MNIC) - Charter High School is hosting a career and college fair for our graduating seniors who otherwise have limited opportunities, resources, and connections for building a successful future. MNIC runs on grants, a small staff, an army of volunteers, and depends on donations for majority of funding for extra curricular activities. We are looking for donations to fund this event to not only celebrate our seniors but help them with their post-high school planning. We have no money in our budget for food, prizes, or to cover the cost of parking for our speakers. This money would help us do so.

MNIC runs on grants, a small staff, an army of volunteers, and depends on donations for majority of funding for extra curricular activities. We are looking for donations to fund this event to not only celebrate our seniors but help them with their post-high school planning. We have no money in our budget for food, prizes, or to cover the cost of parking for our speakers. This money would help us do so.

story:
The Stigma of Mental Illness

Unlike physical illnesses, where you can point to a part of you that hurts, there’s nowhere for a person suffering from mental disorders to point to. Even worse, is the expectation to act normally, to stuff those feelings down - to ‘just get over it.’ We wouldn’t demand that a person missing a leg run a race, so why should we demand that a person whose mind is hurting continue to act and react the way we expect them to? Why should we invalidate their prison, simply because it is one we cannot see? The great thing about the mind is that mental illness is not a permanent place as you will discover in this book.

The Author

My name is Alberto Botero, a Transformational and Life Coach for over 25 years, and I have been clinically depressed for most of my life. Battling psychological and emotional obstacles, as well as being  socially awkward from as young as 5, I didn’t think there would ever be a time when I could speak openly and confidently about my challenges, the struggles of working through them, and most importantly, use my experiences and research in a way that benefit others.

The Project

Thinking in Images: The Path to Being is a representation of my journey and research thus far – a journey that began with the idea that it shouldn’t be impossible for me or anyone to regain a healthy emotional life without the use of medications; that there should be a more effective way to alter our view of ourselves and our life than what we have been exposed to. Inspired by the lives and stories of the countless persons I have taught, coached, and reached out to, I realized that this book held a story that was bigger than myself, one that could be used to help the persons that I could not physically reach out to.

It is with this in mind that I have decided to take this project to Indiegogo, in the hopes that I might gain the $9,700 worth funding needed to hire a self-publishing company that will present and promote the book to a wider audience, and if all goes well, lead to a major publishing house picking it up.

To those who pre-order, every dollar counts, and I invite you to check out my reward tier, where you can secure advanced copies of the book, and a coaching session with myself where anything goes. Even if you cannot donate at this time, I invite you to share this campaign on your social media, and with friends and family, as a gesture to help spread the word.

If you or a loved one suffering from a mental issue has ever wondered if life could get better, then support this project, and let us take a journey from inside our heads, out into life.

Thank you for taking the time to read this,

Alberto

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f_vzijx71j0 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIZOO9p2ODk


 Blurb

Many people live their entire lives consistently unaware of why their relationships fail, their jobs don’t fulfil them, and why nothing seems to fill the hole in their hearts. Like a dark cloud always looming, failure becomes inevitable, and depression becomes a constant companion. The invisible prison of the mind is stronger than any man-made prison, but thankfully, there is a way out. We are unique beings that given the opportunity will shine in ways that we would not imagine possible.

After years of intense research and over 25 years of experience as a life coach, Alberto Botero has developed a sustainable formula for helping people navigate the labyrinth of their mind, effectively reversing a lifetime programming produced by trauma and negative experiences. Thinking in Images: The Path to Being is not designed in the same way as a typical self-help book; its content is meant to be absorbed rather than learned, and information is repeated in order to solidify the concepts in the reader’s mind. Botero expertly shows us how to confront our biggest enemy--the mind, in order to destroy its destructive agenda and break its power over our lives.

Inspired by the overwhelming positive responses from his clients as a certified life coach and attendees at his seminars, Botero knows he needed to find a way to extend the reach of his message, helping more people break free from the confines of their mind, finally able to live the rich and fulfilling lives they deserve.

The goal is to bring simplicity to our thought processing so we can become functional, available. To depart from the convoluted intellectual processing of information and the automatic reaction when we feel emotionally threatened, and thus, to dive into experiencing life, to Being.

For a flying bird, understanding the physics of its flight and the mechanics of its movement in the air does not matter. What he does is fulfilling his nature, so he flies. We, like the bird, want to fulfill our true nature. We want to flap our wings and keep flying.
story_txt:
The Stigma of Mental IllnessUnlike physical illnesses, where you can point to a part of
you that hurts, there’s nowhere for a person suffering from mental disorders to
point to. Even worse, is the expectation to act normally, to stuff those
feelings down - to ‘just get over it.’ We wouldn’t demand that a person missing
a leg run a race, so why should we demand that a person whose mind is hurting
continue to act and react the way we expect them to? Why should we invalidate
their prison, simply because it is one we cannot see? The great thing about the mind is that mental illness is not a permanent place as you will discover in this book.
The Author
My name is Alberto Botero, a Transformational and Life Coach
for over 25 years, and I have been clinically depressed for most of my life.
Battling psychological and emotional obstacles, as well as being  socially awkward from as young as 5, I didn’t think there would ever be a
time when I could speak openly and confidently about my challenges, the
struggles of working through them, and most importantly, use my experiences and
research in a way that benefit others.
The Project
Thinking in Images: The Path to Being is a representation of
my journey and research thus far – a journey that began with the idea that it
shouldn’t be impossible for me or anyone to regain a healthy emotional life
without the use of medications; that there should be a more effective way to
alter our view of ourselves and our life than what we have been exposed to.
Inspired by the lives and stories of the countless persons I have taught,
coached, and reached out to, I realized that this book held a story that was
bigger than myself, one that could be used to help the persons that I could not
physically reach out to.
It is with this in mind that I have decided to take this
project to Indiegogo, in the hopes that I might gain the $9,700 worth funding
needed to hire a self-publishing company that will present and promote the book
to a wider audience, and if all goes well, lead to a major publishing house
picking it up.
To those who pre-order, every dollar counts, and I invite you
to check out my reward tier, where you can secure advanced copies of the book,
and a coaching session with myself where anything goes. Even if you cannot
donate at this time, I invite you to share this campaign on your social media,
and with friends and family, as a gesture to help spread the word.
If you or a loved one suffering from a mental issue has ever
wondered if life could get better, then support this project, and let us take a
journey from inside our heads, out into life.
Thank you for taking the time to read this,
Albertohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f_vzijx71j0 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIZOO9p2ODk Blurb

story:
We are Salford Cheer Association, we run to deliver FREE cheerleading and dance coaching to the communities of Salford and Manchester, allowing children and adults from disadvantaged backgrounds to participate in a sport that would usually be unavailable to them.

 We are looking for more funding to keep the squad going; allowing us to give more opportunities for children and adults to join in and get active! We are looking to secure our current practice space for longer creating a safe environment for them to learn. We would also love to buy uniforms for the children as we don't currently have the money to do so. We do performances within the community giving the children something to achieve and progress towards. 

Our future aims are to even take the squad to competitions !  SCA is run by three volunteer coaches who are truly passionate about the cause, it has been running for just over a year and the children keep coming because they love what we do! As coaches we do this voluntarily and we care deeply about the community. Any money would make a massive difference to the community squad, it will help us take a step in the right direction to make SCA bigger, better and expand out to reach more adults and kids and help them get active and strive to be the best they can!  

Please share this around &  thank you for reading!  

Salford Cheer Association x

https://www.facebook.com/SalfordCheerleadingAssociation?ref=hl

story:
Join BHeart in raising $11,000 by June 15 to support a group* of Bosnian and Herzegovinian women who were victims of sexual violence during the 92-95 war. The funds will support the education of their children and cover the costs of the counseling organization that helps the victims deal with trauma and social stigmatization.

The conflict in Bosnia and Herzegovina (B&H) ended in 1995, but the hardship is not over for the tens of thousands of women and girls who were victims of violence and rape.

While the rapists walk free, many people refuse either to believe or accept what happened. This denial and social stigmatization have compounded their burden of shame and humiliation. Living on the margins of society, they lack financial stability and struggle to provide education for their children.

Such is the group of women in eastern B&H whom we would like to help. Jasmina is one of these women. She and her husband have three children who have not been told of their mother's painful past. One is a child with special needs. The eldest son interrupted his university studies due to the lack of funds as both of his parents are unemployed. Jasmina's greatest wish is that her children have better lives than their mother.

 

 

My dear friend,

Although we have not met, every time I write to you I feel the warmth of friendship... Even now, as I write this, I am crying,  and I don't know why. Women, victims of war, need to be in contact with and surrounded by friends. I feel that all of you far away are true friends. I thank God that people like you exist and do not allow evil to win. I pray from the bottom of my heart that such evil never happens anywhere again" – an excerpt    from a letter to BHeart written by a rape victim.

 

 

Please act now and help Jasmina and other women war victims and their children! Your generosity will make a crucial difference in their everyday lives.

The funds raised will:  

    • Support their children’s education for one school year through a monthly stipend that will pay for books, school transport and meals, and if our donations are generous enough, buy them sports gear and computers.

    • Fund the counseling organization that not only provides a meeting place where the women feel safe, can discuss their traumas and seek professional counsel, but also fights for their rights.

    • Buy materials for making handicrafts, which provide an important income, as well as a sense of purpose and self-respect.


        BHeart is a volunteer organization that focuses on issues and supports projects that are important for Bosnian and Herzegovinian women and their families.

        BHeart members were inspired by the Bosnian director Jasmila Žbanić’s film,"For Those Who Can Tell No Tales”, which exposes the denial of crimes against women in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The screening of the film and a fundraiser will be organized by BHeart on May 31st in Washington DC.


        All donations are tax deductible. The receipts will be provided to donors at the end of the campaign. The project will be implemented through our local partner, the  Bosana Foundation.

         

        * To protect the privacy of these women and their children, we cannot reveal their names and their counseling organization.

         

        Photo credit: “For Those Who Can Tell No Tales” film poster by Anur Hadziomerspahic, Ideologija      


        For the Bosnian version of this text click here.  

                                                                                                                                                                            

        For additional questions, please contact BHeartDC@gmail.com

story:
EduApp is a company started by brother and sister team James and Hannah Kelly, with the aim of providing innovative resources for teachers. These resources so far consist of mobile apps, allowing teachers to utilise smartphones and tablets in a classroom environment.

Who Are We?

James Kelly is a software engineer who previously completed his PhD in Astrophysics. James has published 6 peer-reviewed academic papers in well respected journals, and has a passion for education. He has also developed successful apps in the past, with a combined total of over 2000 downloads.

Hannah Kelly is a qualified teacher with a speciality in Mathematics, who is currently completing her first year of teaching in a UK High School. During her time as a teacher Hannah has spent many hours developing resources for her classes, and shares the frustrations of fellow educators. She has many ideas for the role of technology in the classroom. 

What We Need & What You Get

EduApp have already developed 3 apps, these have been well received by teaching communities on social networks such as Twitter and Reddit, and have been featured in Education Daily.

The most successful app so far has been the Quiet Classroom:

The app allows teachers to set a threshold level, and when noise in the classroom surpasses the threshold, an alarm sounds. The app allows microphone sensitivity to be configured, and offers a choice of 3 different alarm sounds.

We are very happy with how things are going, however we have big ideas and we feel we need the following:

  • We must go cross-platform, currently we only publish on Android, however we need to be on iOS, Windows, Blackberry and Firefox OS to maximise our impact. This involves purchasing a great deal of equipment for testing and development. 
  • To make our apps more effective we want to improve our graphical user interfaces, to this end we need to work with a graphic designer.
  • We have a number of ideas for social apps, involving direct interaction between users, to develop and host these we will incur server costs.  
  • As a contributor you will receive free and discounted EduApp software.
  • You will also receive early access to EduApp products, and will be invited to participate in Beta testing.
Achieving our goals will mean we can set to work on our ideas, which include more tools to allow teachers to manage classroom behaviour - such as Quiet Classroom - along with learning tools tailored to specific curricula.

The Impact

We believe that the rapid advances in smartphone and tablets over the last few years has presented an opportunity to revolutionise education. Combining software engineering expertise with the vibrancy of a newly qualified teacher familiar with the modern teaching curriculum, we believe, presents us with the ability to lead this revolution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to provide financial backing you can still contribute towards the development of EduApp.

  • You could try out an EduApp product, and leave us some feedback.
  • You could email us an idea for an app you'd like.
  • Help spread the word! Why not share this page on your Facebook/Twitter/Google+ profile?

story:
I am looking for your support for my project to build a playroom and library at the St. Joseph's orphanage in Owerri, Nigeria. We raised about 1500 GBP last year and in July this year I am travelling there with my family for 2 weeks to supervise the works.


The orphanage is run by the Holy Family Sisters of the Needy, a female order of the Catholic Church. It was founded in 1983 and is located at Okwu Uratta Road, Owerri, Imo State, Nigeria.


How much can you afford to give? 


If you have time, come to our fundraising summer party on 28 June from 4-10pm at the Gunnersbury Triangle Club, Acton, Princes Avenue, W3 8LT. 

If not please make a small donation towards the project. 


Used English books and small toys in good conditions are also welcome. 


Many thanks 


Felix and family

story:
Holly Killion, Retired Naval Officer, Nurse Practitioner, Wife, Mother, Grandmother, Daughter, Sister, and Friend passed away suddenly and unexpectedly On December 17th, 2013. 

Many people are reaching out and wanting to help. We appreciate all the love and support but were struggling to come up with some way for people to help as we are fortunate enough to the have the things to meet our immediate needs.

For Holly, her family came first...always.  She had struggled with illness since 2004 but when she was retired from the Navy she pushed through and completed her Masters degree to take care of others.  Because of her illness we had not yet gotten to a place financially to help our children with their education but we were working towards that goal. Then Joy of Joys we found we had a grandson and Gabe became Holly's whole world.  She was so excited for this Christmas with all our children and Gabe and for the future we had with them.  Tragedy has struck and with her loss I see no way of helping the children with their education or setting up a fund for Gabe (and future grand-babies) education without your help.  So here is the plan: any money raised will be put in an education fund to help Gabe in the future and to leave a legacy of love and caring that Holly would be proud of.  If we happen to blow past our goal it would be of great help to be able to assist Cody, Charissa, and Colton with their College education as well.

What you will accomplish.

Not only will you fund the education of a fantastic child, but you will enable him to have a tangible tie to a grandmother who loved him with her whole heart.  We are dearly going to strive for him to never forget her.  If we blow past the goal, you will help Holly and I realize our dream of aiding our children and future grandchildren as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help in anyway you can.  Whatever donation you can give is greatly appreciated but share this with everyone you know and lets get the word out!  Holly was the love of my life and I am lost without her but if we can do something meaningful that leaves a lasting legacy I will be truly grateful.
