story:
The Place:

We - Sodzo International (along with the Methodist Church of Kenya) have a 72 acre farm in Northern Kenya that is a rescue/refuge for 35+ orphans/vulnerable children aged 8-14.  We are teaching employment skills, life skills (sport is included) to all the children with a focus on positively reintegrating them within their community.  We are looking to scale to meet the need of every child in the area as well as becoming self-sufficient in the coming year.

There are a variety of converging and catastrophic events that force a child to leave home to live on the streets. In speaking with the children, we found they have experienced everything from physical and sexual violence, to being kicked out of their homes after a parent has decided there are too many children under one roof, or to being orphaned after HIV/AIDS took the life of a loved one. As children are driven to the streets, the closest thing to family they can find is a group centered substance abuse, violence, and a shared despair from the lack of a brighter future.

We have developed an intervention to help each child transition from their current place on the street to active community life where they will be productive members and leaders. The intervention includes vocational and classroom-based education, psycho-social support, sport and spiritual formation with peers and mentors, all within a safe place to recover from their glue addiction. The program will conclude with a staged reintegration into the community by tailoring a unique exit strategy, including post-intervention support for each child.

The Trip:
We will be delivering supplies, fellowship with local staff and love and care for the children of Maua in October.   One major request has been sporting supplies to go along with the soccer field (level land!) Engineer without Borders graciously implemented earlier this year.  Currently, many of the kids are playing their favorite sport bare foot which can be problematic.   We would love to form a FC Watoto in the future and possibly team up with the surrounding community and compete!

Perhaps hearken back to your youth and the joy of playing soccer or a sport with your friends. We would like to provide those moment of joy for each of the children living at the farm.  Each of these youth have had a very rough go and we feel sport provides a wonderful and healthy outlet.  

My View: 
As many of you know me, I can be a critical ole boy in many regards - there are very few causes or people i would walk off a cliff for (with some serious prayer of course).  I have found a few individuals/orgs my life including -  David Leyerle, Scott Jeffries and the board/Kenyan staff we have here at Sodzo.  I mention them b/c many of you know them.  They are people that embody the spirit of light and true meaning of walking the Christian faith thru action.  I am hoping you take a moment and some resource to take a step with me/us.  

Why Africa? - isn't it a money pit and hopeless?  Why not the United States  - there is great need on our country!  That was my first thoughts prior to being a part in forming Sodzo.  It is a valid concern.  The kids in this community are born into a foundation of broken glass and have the virtually no support other than a glue addiction to alleviate the pains of merely existing.  What would Jesus Christ think of this situation?  It is not acceptable.  

I truly believe that human condition of spiritual pain and suffering is all relative to a point, but this level was a new point.  We can't solve the world's problems all at once or even a community's problem at once.  We can take action and work thru Christ and begin to transform pain and suffering to joy.  It comes down to spiritual relationships for every single person involved, of which, I feel we have relationships to be good stewards of time and resources and truly make a LASTING difference to the kids on the farm.  

  
Your contributions won't be lost in a pit of well-intentioned (even sometimes deleterious) NGO work.
story_txt: The Place:We - Sodzo International (along with the Methodist Church of Kenya) have a 72 acre farm in Northern Kenya that is a rescue/refuge for 35+ orphans/vulnerable children aged 8-14.  We are teaching employment skills, life skills (sport is included) to all the children with a focus on positively reintegrating them within their community.  We are looking to scale to meet the need of every child in the area as well as becoming self-sufficient in the coming year.There are a variety of converging and catastrophic events that force a child to leave home to live on the streets. In speaking with the children, we found they have experienced everything from physical and sexual violence, to being kicked out of their homes after a parent has decided there are too many children under one roof, or to being orphaned after HIV/AIDS took the life of a loved one. As children are driven to the streets, the closest thing to family they can find is a group centered substance abuse, violence, and a shared despair from the lack of a brighter future.We have developed an intervention to help each child transition from their current place on the street to active community life where they will be productive members and leaders. The intervention includes vocational and classroom-based education, psycho-social support, sport and spiritual formation with peers and mentors, all within a safe place to recover from their glue addiction. The program will conclude with a staged reintegration into the community by tailoring a unique exit strategy, including post-intervention support for each child.The Trip:We will be delivering supplies, fellowship with local staff and love and care for the children of Maua in October.   One major request has been sporting supplies to go along with the soccer field (level land!) Engineer without Borders graciously implemented earlier this year.  Currently, many of the kids are playing their favorite sport bare foot which can be problematic.   We would love to form a FC Watoto in the future and possibly team up with the surrounding community and compete!Perhaps hearken back to your youth and the joy of playing soccer or a sport with your friends. We would like to provide those moment of joy for each of the children living at the farm.  Each of these youth have had a very rough go and we feel sport provides a wonderful and healthy outlet.  My View: As many of you know me, I can be a critical ole boy in many regards - there are very few causes or people i would walk off a cliff for (with some serious prayer of course).  I have found a few individuals/orgs my life including -  David Leyerle, Scott Jeffries and the board/Kenyan staff we have here at Sodzo.  I mention them b/c many of you know them.  They are people that embody the spirit of light and true meaning of walking the Christian faith thru action.  I am hoping you take a moment and some resource to take a step with me/us.  Why Africa? - isn't it a money pit and hopeless?  Why not the United States  - there is great need on our country!  That was my first thoughts prior to being a part in forming Sodzo.  It is a valid concern.  The kids in this community are born into a foundation of broken glass and have the virtually no support other than a glue addiction to alleviate the pains of merely existing.  What would Jesus Christ think of this situation?  It is not acceptable.  I truly believe that human condition of spiritual pain and suffering is all relative to a point, but this level was a new point.  We can't solve the world's problems all at once or even a community's problem at once.  We can take action and work thru Christ and begin to transform pain and suffering to joy.  It comes down to spiritual relationships for every single person involved, of which, I feel we have relationships to be good stewards of time and resources and truly make a LASTING difference to the kids on the farm.    Your contributions won't be lost in a pit of well-intentioned (even sometimes deleterious) NGO work.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ronnika K. Davis. I am a soon to be Alumni of Virginia State University and will obtain a degree in Psychology. As a Psychology Major, I have developed a career goal of assisting families affected by Mental Illness and I am currently extracting savvy strategies to obtaining knowledge that will assist me in achieving this goal. 

 My current strategy is listed below: 

The “Social Innovation Leadership Dream” project that I am campaigning for has been developed to raise the necessary funds to participate in the Social Innovation Program at George Mason University.  This is an annual summer program for undergraduate and graduate Students in which 25 elite competitively chosen leaders and aspiring social innovators will be taught the fundamentals of establishing social change. As entrepreneurs, we will also obtain hands-on field experience within an assigned community by using the skills that are taught to develop a blueprint for specific partner non-profit organizations.

What your support will be used for?

Through this campaign, I am hoping to achieve my goal of raising $600 towards tuition for the George Mason University Social Innovation Program. This programs will assist me in establishing change within large and small communities while developing creative/critical thinking skills which is an important asset for young adults within the competitive realm of academia/working force.  The Social Innovation Program will thoroughly develop these skills along with providing networking and lucrative contacts as well.  Sponsorship for this project will contribute to room & board, food expenses, and the purchasing of books and other materials for the program. 

Review the side panel to your RIGHT to see what perks you will receive for assisting me!

The Impact

My attendance within this program will not only assist me with learning the necessary skills to establish social change, but I will also take the time to assist partnering non-profits and communities within the academic program area with my services.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Completely unable to contribute? Please feel free to share this campaign on your Facebook statuses and friends' pages.

 

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!

story:
Raising World Awareness of Light Pollution in 6.5 minutes

The International Dark-Sky Association (IDA), in collaboration with Loch Ness Productions, has recently produced a free-for-download video highlighting the issues regarding light pollution, titled "Losing the Dark." 

Losing the Dark is 6.5-minute public service announcement that is being distributed free of charge as a high-definition flat screen video for your use; use in science centers, classrooms, and streaming from the Web; and for both traditional and full dome digital planetarium theaters.

Light pollution is a worldwide problem that needs a worldwide solution. Losing the Dark explains how light pollution impacts wildlife, wastes energy, reduces visibility, threatens human health, and more. It also offers simple solutions that anyone can do, reminding us all that that it is not too late to save the nighttime environment.

However, Losing the Dark currently exists only in English and we want everyone to have access to its message. With your help we will raise the necessary funds to produce translated versions for people worldwide. We are currently working with volunteers that can provide translation and narration services. When those are ready we need the funds to pay our production company to combine the new narrations with the show’s visuals and music, producing a final, translated version ready for the world to see.

This is an elaborate process, as the show is freely available in some 23 different formats ranging from domed planetarium versions to flat screen HD.

Translations for Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Mandarin and Spanish will soon be finished. We have also had requests for: Cantonese, Hebrew, Polish, Portuguese, Russian and others. We will provide as many language versions as we can based on demand and funding. 

If translated, it is estimated that the PSA could be seen by 250,000 viewers annually worldwide, raising awareness of dark sky preservation globally.

With your help we will be able to complete all of these translations so that any planetarium or school can include the PSA in their regular educational program

You can see Losing the Dark on IDA's YouTube Channel http://youtu.be/dd82jaztFIo

Teachers, planetarium theater operators and anyone interested in spreading the word about light pollution can freely download the show in a variety of formats. With your help we will complete the translations so that they can all hear the message. Take a look at http://www.darksky.org/losingthedark

Enjoy the show and thank you for your support.

Risks and challenges

IDA started work on the PSA over a year ago during very difficult financial times. With the support of donors, we were finally able to raise the $20,000 to cover the cost to produce the English version at the end of 2012. Now we need your help to make the international versions.

We continue to look for funding from many different sources but are hoping that the indiegogo community will see the benefit of getting this program into the hands of anyone in the world. Donating a little or as much as you would like, will spread this film across the globe.

story:
Summary

I have been invited to spend my senior year abroad at the University of Dance and Circus in Stockholm, Sweden! This is the opportunity of a life time for me as a performer and the school is creating this exchange program specifically for me! I am beyond excited and honored that I have been chosen for this opportunity. Why me? They like the way I think, the way I juggle, and how I put the two together. 

Juggling is what I live for, my love, my passion, and hopefully my career. Participating in this program is the next step for me to be able to make my dream a reality. 

What I Need

Stockholm is one of the most expensive cities in the world, not to mention transportation back and forth across the pond. I will have to find my own flat and pay for living expences as well as for school. I am holding four shows to raise money for this very purpose but if you are unable to make it to Louisville, KY for those than this is another way you could help.  

The Impact

Modern circus is thriving in europe. This experience would not only give me a fantastic education in dance, theatre, acrobatics, and an expansion of my juggling but will also alow me to get a foot in the door into european circus. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am having four shows to help raise money as well in Louisville, KY.

  • May 24th, 5:00, at the Vault1031, 1031 S. 6th Street
  • May 25th, 5:00, at the Vault1031, 1031 S. 6th Street
  • May 31st, 7:30, at Central Presbyterian Church, 318 W. Kentucky St.
  • June 2nd, 2:30, at Central Presbyterian Church, 318 W. Kentucky St.

An even simpler way to help if you can't contribute is to spread the word. I am really excited about this opportunity and I hope that you can share in some of my excitement and to share it with all of your friends!

Thank you!

story:
About Us

      The East Tennessee State University Advertising Club is a student organization that offers students the opportunity to develop their critical thinking abilities and creativity. By applying these skills to real world situations we aim to prepare them for a career in integrated marketing communications.


How Do We Do This?

      We believe that an active and engaged student body is essential to fostering a sense of pride for our community and ensuring a positive college experience for students here at ETSU. It is for this reason that we partner with other student organizations on campus in order to help raise awareness for events and causes that clubs support with the hope of increasing student engagement.

      Also, as proud members of the American Advertising Federation (AAF), the nations oldest advertising trade association, ETSU Ad Club encourages its members to compete in the National Student Advertising Competition each spring as representatives of both AAF District 7 and ETSU. 


What We’re Trying To Do

      Insight/Interaction is a two-day student conference in Washington, D.C. sponsored by the AAF where students can learn about the field of advertising, discover what trends are developing in the industry and get a jump start on their career by networking with knowledgeable advertising professionals. 

      We believe our attendance at this conference is vital to the future role that Ad Club will play here at ETSU. Ad Club strives to be the social media center for all organizations on campus, and we believe that we can accomplish this goal through the skills that we will gain from the Insight/Interaction conference.

       We want this conference to not only impact the students attending; we want the ENTIRE campus to benefit as well. We plan to accomplish this by inviting professionals to share their knowledge of the advertising field by speaking at seminars on campus. 


What We Need: $1,500 out of $3,750 total

      We're excited to have such a large group of students wanting to attend this event (20) but of this of course means that we need to raise money in order to make this trip possible. This is where YOU can help!! 

      We have set a goal of $1,500 to help cover the cost of registration fees for our members as well as the cost of gas to get us there:
  • $30 Registration Fee x 20 Students = $600
  • $180 Estimated For Gas x 5 Cars  = $900

      Every little bit helps us get one step closer to our goal so please donate what you can! We've lined up some great "perks" so that you can get a little something back for your donation too!

story:
The Tremblant 24h of cycling is a biking event designed for cyclists of all experience levels. It takes place this year from September 6 to 9 on the prestigious Circuit Mont-Tremblant race track. This unique event is a relay race between teams of 6 to 12 members, who will relay each other over a 24-hour period on the closed 4.26 km track. Beyond being a mere race, however, the 24h of cycling is a fundraising event for the benefit of children's cause.

http://www.24htremblant.com/en/


Hello,


My name is Thibault Derennes and i will ride with my team named:

Ô SPINNING 5 

 
I am glad to be a part of this race and i'm here to ask for your help to give us a donation, every amount count. This is an amazing experience and idea to do this type of fundraising event and for the benefit of children's cause is even better. Any donation will help the foundations to be able to provided the best healthcare for the children in need and those who are sick.

Thanks you for your help !!!

If you want to donate directly to me, you can go there:
http://donation.24htremblant.com/Pages/Participants/Participant.aspx?partner=10&participant=7210

We ride for: 


FOR THE CAUSE…
Thanks to the participation of 125 teams and a total of 1030 cyclists in 20112, the 3rd edition of the event raised the incredible sum of $604,338 for children fighting cancer and underprivileged kids via the beneficiary foundations; the Grand Défi Pierre Lavoie, the Sainte-Justine UHC Foundation, the Cedars Cancer Institute,  and Fondation Tremblant.

FOR THE FUN…
Cycle in the safety of a private circuit in the magnificent region of Mont-Tremblant and enjoy a weekend filled with great memories and outdoor animation and activities for both participants and spectators.

FOR THE CHALLENGE…
The pivotal activity of the 24h is a team cycling relay race, that takes place over 24 consecutive hours on the Circuit Mont-Tremblant. Teams take on the feat of cycling as many laps as possible during the 24 hour period, but above all the ultimate quest is to raise the maximum possible amount in aid of the beneficiary foundations.







THE BENEFICIARY FOUNDATIONS

The mission of the Tremblant 24h Foundation is to raise funds for the benefit of children's causes via unique sporting events in the Mont-Tremblant region; mainly the Tremblant Resort.

THE CHU SAINTE-JUSTINE FOUNDATION

Our mission at the CHU Sainte-Justine Foundation is to engage the community and support Sainte-Justine in its pursuit of excellence and its commitment to providing the children of today and tomorrow with one of the highest levels of healthcare in the world.

LE GRAND DÉFI PIERRE LAVOIE

Grand défi Pierre Lavoie would like to thank the organizers, participants, and partners of Tremblant’s 24h of cycling. Thanks to your support we can continue with our efforts to encourage youths to continue their education. And thus the ''Aiguise ta matière grise'' contest has been deployed in Quebec primary schools and Grand défi Pierre Lavoie plays its role in educating youths about education perseverance and how dropping out of school can be prevented.

THE TREMBLANT FOUNDATION

Since the first edition of the the 24h of cycling in 2010, the Tremblant Foundation has been a beneficiary. The objective of the foundation is to help underprivileged children in the Laurentians to attain a better quality of life & develop their full potential in sporting, educational, artistic & cultural activities.


The campaign will stop the  day before the race to be able to gain as much donation as we can! 

Every single donation will go to these foundations


Thanks you again

story:
Hello, my name is Joe Torpey, I am 21 years old and currently attend Montana State University in Bozeman, Montana. While in college, I have decided to dedicate my life to teaching children. I am studying Elementary Education with a focus in Reading. I am also an artist, volunteer, tutor and mentor.

Growing up, I was overweight. I was always the “Big kid” in class. It was tough, and I never felt like I fit in with the other kids. Although I had friends throughout my childhood, I always knew I was different.

During the second half of my senior year in high school, I joined weight watchers. It was the time in my life where I myself had decided enough was enough. I wanted to lose weight. No one told me I had to do this. It was my own choice.

Over the next 13 months, I lost 85 pounds and became a whole new person. This was an interesting transition to make during the time between high school and college. I had left high school overweight, and entered college as an average 18 year old.

One of the most interesting things was to see how people treated me differently.

In 2010, I was chosen as one of Weight Watcher’s role models.

http://www.weightwatchers.com/Templates/Marketing/Marketing_Utool_1col.aspx?pageid=1169371

After receiving this award, I was featured in the local newspaper.

http://mtstandard.com/news/local/article_a6a89e76-d4ea-11df-a675-001cc4c002e0.html

After the story had ran, I was overwhelmed by the outpour of support, questions, inspiration and much more. Many people reached out to me for advice, including families with overweight children.

It is an absolute passion of mine to share my weight challenges with people, along with my story of success, but my ultimate passion is to get the word out to young children.

I have written a children’s book, about a bear and a bird, who are outcasts with their peers because of their weight. The bear, Burley, is overweight and the bird, Wurley, is underweight. These are both major challenges facing children today, and within this book are ways for children to deal with these hardships they may encounter.

A dear friend of mine, Hannah Safford, is working side by side with me to illustrate this book. Hannah is also studying at Montana State University - Art Education. 

This book provides children with ways overcome being an outcast due to weight. It provides them with social aspects on how to create friendships along with integrating activity and healthy eating into their everyday lives. Allowing children to make the decision of when to become healthy is one of my greatest passions. I do not believe we should just tell a kid they need to loose/gain weight. I believe we need to give them the resources to deal with what they may encounter.  

Contributions will go directly toward publishing this children’s book.  

This $1000 will allow me to begin printing the book, and sending it out to publishers. As a token of thanks, for a $20 donation, I will send you a hand written Thank You postcard featuring Burley and Wurley on the front.

The Impact

The impact of this book could become very huge. Growing up overweight, I never knew who to turn to. My doctor always told me I had to lose weight. My gym teacher always allowed me to slip by… It was very tough.

Weight in children, whether the issue is overweight or underweight, is a touchy topic, and there do not seem to be many children’s books about it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, please share this story with your friends through the many social networks out there.
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Joe Torpey, I am 21 years old and currently attend Montana State University in Bozeman, Montana. While in college, I have decided to dedicate my life to teaching children. I am studying Elementary Education with a focus in Reading. I am also an artist, volunteer, tutor and mentor. 
Growing up, I was overweight. I was always the “Big kid” in class. It was tough, and I never felt like I fit in with the other kids. Although I had friends throughout my childhood, I always knew I was different. 
During the second half of my senior year in high school, I joined weight watchers. It was the time in my life where I myself had decided enough was enough. I wanted to lose weight. No one told me I had to do this. It was my own choice. 
Over the next 13 months, I lost 85 pounds and became a whole new person. This was an interesting transition to make during the time between high school and college. I had left high school overweight, and entered college as an average 18 year old. 
One of the most interesting things was to see how people treated me differently. 
In 2010, I was chosen as one of Weight Watcher’s role models. 
http://www.weightwatchers.com/Templates/Marketing/Marketing_Utool_1col.aspx?pageid=1169371
After receiving this award, I was featured in the local newspaper. 
http://mtstandard.com/news/local/article_a6a89e76-d4ea-11df-a675-001cc4c002e0.html
After the story had ran, I was overwhelmed by the outpour of support, questions, inspiration and much more. Many people reached out to me for advice, including families with overweight children. 
It is an absolute passion of mine to share my weight challenges with people, along with my story of success, but my ultimate passion is to get the word out to young children.  I have written a children’s book, about a bear and a bird, who are outcasts with their peers because of their weight. The bear, Burley, is overweight and the bird, Wurley, is underweight. These are both major challenges facing children today, and within this book are ways for children to deal with these hardships they may encounter.
A dear friend of mine, Hannah Safford, is working side by side with me to illustrate this book. Hannah is also studying at Montana State University - Art Education. 
This book provides children with ways overcome being an outcast due to weight. It provides them with social aspects on how to create friendships along with integrating activity and healthy eating into their everyday lives. Allowing children to make the decision of when to become healthy is one of my greatest passions. I do not believe we should just tell a kid they need to loose/gain weight. I believe we need to give them the resources to deal with what they may encounter.  
Contributions will go directly toward publishing this children’s book.  
This $1000 will allow me to begin printing the book, and sending it out to publishers. As a token of thanks, for a $20 donation, I will send you a hand written Thank You postcard featuring Burley and Wurley on the front. 
The Impact
The impact of this book could become very huge. Growing up overweight, I never knew who to turn to. My doctor always told me I had to lose weight. My gym teacher always allowed me to slip by… It was very tough. 
Weight in children, whether the issue is overweight or underweight, is a touchy topic, and there do not seem to be many children’s books about it. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot contribute, please share this story with your friends through the many social networks out there.

story:
Hello to one and all!

Who is this guy?

My name is Clayton Hamburg and I have been performing on stage since the age of eight.  The path of performance that I have persued has taken me deeply into the realm of physicality.  I thorougly enjoy the use of the body to express myself as I find my artistic journey coming to a new peak.

What does he want?

With your gracious assistance I will attend a summer workshop focusing on gestural grammar, body articulation, counterweights, walks and displacements in space, Figures of Style, Mobile Statuary, Dynamorythm and the Musicality of Movement.  All of these things will assist me in furthering the development of unique characters in the future.  in short, I want to be a mime.

Why does he want it?

By contributing you will allow me the opportunity to dig deeper into my physical potential, unleasing a controlled beast from within. 

 

What does he NEED?

My aim is for $600 in funding. This is broken down into two catagories-

 

1. The $400 tuition

 

2. The $200 travel budget

 

3. There is No #3 because some gracious angels have provided me housing if I make my goal!



How does this effect the world at large?

This skill set will be witnessed by the thousands of people that I am blessed enough to inteact with at the Renaissance Faires which I work at throughout the year, as well as by those attending shows in which I originate roles.



For those of you who don't know:


I am generally a bustling ball of bouncing energy.  Some have dubbed me; "A puppy-squirrel hybrid on amphetamines", and "A veritable whirlwind of energy", among many more nicknames of similar ilk.  My aim is to find focus for my energy and drive it out in very specific ways with precise choices thereby harnessing my natural wellspring to create beautiful art.

 

The world around you is a gentler, kinder, more beautiful place when you make great art.  Please donate to my campaign so that I might enhance the world around all of us.

story:
Her name is Jacquelin Motta and she is a victim and SURVIVOR of domestic abuse.  Jacquelin arrived in this country from the Dominican Republic speaking no English.  Since that time she became a US citizen, a teacher in the New York Public School System and a caretaker of her two children, ages 5 and 8.  When Jacquelin got married in 1999 it was for better or for worse.  She had no idea the impact of the “for worse” would have on her.  In her own words Jacquelin confesses to being sexually assaulted by her estranged husband who also physically and psychologically abused her.   She has had to deal with multiple rapes as well as the financial and emotional strain of her estranged husband’s gambling and alcohol addictions.  A diagnosis of PTSD (post traumatic stress disorder) led to her losing temporary custody of her little girls to the perpetrator of her abuse.  After many years of traumatizing abuse Jacquelin found the strength to go back to school with one goal in mind; to create a better life for her two daughters and take them away from the unhealthy environment they were forced to live in.  Hiding from her estranged husband as a fugitive she secretly attended law classes at St John’s University in Queens, NY (without any sort of marital support).  Since being separated from her estranged husband in 2010 Jacquelin has completed a LL.M law degree from St. Johns and dreams of one day as a future lawyer being able to champion the cause of women and children victims of domestic violence.    Right now that is only a far-reaching dream.  Her current reality is plagued with unemployment, no financial resources and strapped with marital obligations she cannot pay. She is dealing with the hardships of a pending divorce and stands in jeopardy of losing her home in the interim.  As bad as that all appears the worst of it doesn’t compare with losing custody of her children.  Jacquelin’s greatest fear is that her children will suffer the same fate she has at the hands of her perpetrator.  In their father’s custody they are already showing serious signs of dysfunction and neglect.

Jacquelin Motta is in jeopardy of losing her children permanently and would like to raise funds to pay for a court-required forensic evaluation to regain custody of her children.  She also would like to be able to afford proper legal representation in her custody case.  She needs minimally $10,000 for legal fees to pay for the court-required forensic evaluation and to hire a decent lawyer who can help her obtain custody of her children.  The magnitude of the public’s help would be tremendous.  It would allow Jacquelin to rescue her daughters from potentially emotional and bodily harm.  Once she has full custody of her children and they are safe she can then focus on making a better life for the three of them.  Your contributions would contribute to her survival and ultimately enable her to contribute her time, efforts and legal know-how to advocating for women and children of domestic violence with support groups and legal representation.  Whatever funds are raised will go toward her legal fees.  Domestic abuse hurts everyone! Each survivor has an obligation to reach and teach others how to survive.  Jacquelin’s life has been forever changed yet that pain will one day turn another victims pain into joy… If you cannot contribute financially than pray.  She needs all the help she can get.  Help spread Jacquelin’s story so another women does not too have to suffer in silence.  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
From City Streets... 

The MylifE Foundation has been working with youth on the city streets for ten years. In that time they have found that a very large number of youth ending up carrying the label of "street child" and all the pain that goes with it, are coming from rural areas in the country believing that the city holds all the opportunities and recognition they seek. The sad reality is that many of these youth end up being disheartened and their talents and gift go unnoticed. 

...to Rural South Africa

The MylifE Foundation went on a journey through the rural Eastern Cape and into the even more rural Transkei to find out what the impact of youth migration is having in rural communities and what can be done to prevent this from happening. 

What was discovered was not surprising but shocking nonetheless. The number of youth in rural communities is dropping radically, leaving the very old to take care of the very young. The elders have no-one to share their skills with and the little ones are missing a generation of mentors. 

There is a dire need for youth development and continued, sustainable support within these rural communities, giving the youth a platform to learn new skills, create a sustainable community oriented economy and above all, feel empowered to mentor the small children and one day, teach them their skills. 

The Solutions: Training-the-Trainer | Being the Village

Our goal is to create a space for skills development programs that invite our elders to train our youth who in turn pay-it-forward and mentor our young children. 

We have developed a close relationship with the good people at the local rural primary school and have pledged to incorporate our programs into the school's curricular and extra-curricular programs. Already we have teachers eager to participate and the full backing and support of the headmaster and the community.

This brings us to the next solution: creating the Village. We have all heard the expression, "It takes a village to raise a child" but how often have we realised that WE are that village? And how often do we realise that we CAN make a difference where the system is incapable of providing a sustainable solution?

The MylifE journey has led them to connect with pro-active community members and organizations within Hogsback and the surrounding Eastern Cape.

HeArt Space Hogsback is a grass-roots commUnity initiative that offers space and time for skill sharing and micro enterprise in areas of - 

* Volunteering

* Art and Craft

* Organic Food Production

* Moving toward sustainable, off-the-grid living

* Holistic Wellbeing

MylifE and HeArt Space have collaborated to intitiate our.... 

Current Skill Development Project: The Hearts & Hands Needle Craft Project

We have the commitment of two teachers from Crabbush Primary School and 2 female youth from a neighbouring village called Auckland who have pledged to attend the first level Crochet Course in our ever-evolving needle work training program. 

In turn, they will pay-it-forward and teach the children at the school how to crochet. 

 

Where the Funds from This Campaign Will Go

* Admin 

*Stationary

*Transportation for trainer/s (1-2) and participants (4-6)

* Transportation for administrators (2) 

* Accommodation and food for trainers and participants (1-2)

* Cement to level floor

* Plumber to fix toilet 

* Signage for the road

The Impact

Immediate impact is already being seen in the openess and excitement of the local children and youth when we interact with them: there is an eagerness to experience something new, to feel recognized, to be acknowledged and to feel appreciated. 

The biggest impact will be on the local rural primary school. The children here are desperate of skill development, community recognition and self-sustainabilty.

In time we hope to see the local art and craft shop at HeArt Space filled with the creations made by our local youth - a thriving micro-enterprise that celebrates the next generation. Who know where to from there - the sky is the limit! 

Please Share our Vision

If this vision resonates with your idea of being the village we want for our children, please consider leaving a comment in the COMMENTS tap at the top of this page, share with your Facebook Friends and invite others to do the same: this will enhance our GO-GO Factor and gain us more exposure and of course, be the hearts and hands that create the change we want to see. 

Thank You

We appreciate you stopping by and taking the time to find out about our campaign - thank you for being the change!

story:
Falashay Here!

Most of you who will donate to this campaign know me already, but for those of you who know nothing about me here are a few facts about me:

I graduated from DePaul University in Chicago, IL with a BFA in Acting in June of 2009. There I also had an undeclared minor in Arabic. Three days after gratuation, I went to live in Morocco for nearly two months to better study Arabic. After my return to the states I came back to acting and have been apart of a wonderful play call A Twist of Water that will be going to Off-Broadway this fall. 

Recently, I realized that there are a few things that I really want from life and many things that I'd like to learn. One of those things is I want to become fluent in Arabic and learn more about Arab culture. I have found a few wonderful graduate programs that I am dying to apply to, however, there is one little obstacle; I never recieved my Undergraduate diploma! I need that and my officail transcrpt in order to apply to graduate school. Since I took the Morocco trip abroad with my school, they added on an extra $1,1000 as a program fee the summer after I gratuated. I have tried and failed to save up the money to pay them off many times. Your contribution will not only help me finally see that piece of paper that says I graduated from College Cum Laude, but it will also help me be able to apply to gratuate school for the fall of 2013!

What I Need & What You Get

I know to some $1,100 is chump change and wouldn't make much differnece in their life. To me it means finally getting to touch my diploma. It means that I can further my education. It means that I'll be able to have more job opportunities once I further myself by doing a Master's degree. The extra $200 is for the Indigogo and paypal fees for using the service. 

Here's what you will get for helping:

Aside from my love there are some perks for helping me out!

  • If you give $5 I will shout you out on my Facebook and Twitter pages!
  • If you give $25 I will write you a personal email or letter of thanks! This will require either your email or mailing address. Plus the Facebook shout out! 
  • If you give $50 I will give you all of the above, plus a personalized Name card in Arabic calligraphy! This is a really cool perk because you'll get to see what your name looks like in Arabic! This will also require an address.
  • If you're feeling super generous and want to give $500 then you'll get all of the above perks as well as dinner with me and my diploma!

If I reach my goal and somehow surpass it, the additional money will go towards paying off the copious amounts of hospital bills that I have from my Open heart surgery in 2008 and breast lump removal back in July of this year. So if you see that I've reached my goal please don't let that discourage you from still donating if you haven't! This campaign will end on my birthday! I can think of no better present that anyone could give to me!

Other Ways You Can Help

For some I know that financial contributions may not be possible and that's okay! I would just like to ask for your continued support and prayers! Please keep in mind, you don't have to claim a perk to donate any dollar can help and will result in hugs!

story:
1. Organization

Music With A Message For Kids, Inc. is dedicated to bringing FREE educational and motivational music programs to kids in need at Elementary-Middle Schools, Libraries, Youth Organizations, Native American Reservations, and Military bases all over the  U.S.

We are a 501 (c)(3) Non Profit started in 2006 as a response to the need for educational and motivational programs in hurricane damaged New Orleans. We've since been back to that area 4 different times to encourage and motivate kids to get involved in helping their neighbors and in the rebuilding of their Community. In our brief 4 years of existence, we've already provided our service to well over 70,000 kids in 254 Elementary-Middle Schools, Libraries, Youth Organizations and Military Bases in 8 different states, including Michigan, Iowa, Missouri, Illinois, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Wisconsin, and Louisiana. 

 

2. Project Summary

Music With A Message For Kid's purpose in this project is to bring FREE Educational and Motivational music assemblies on Reading/Literacy, Character-anti bullying, and/or Health-Nutrition to inner city kids in at least 80 Elementary Schools in 10 major U.S. cities (Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Detroit, Los Angeles, New York, Phoenix, and San Francisco), over the next 2 school years. The funds from this campaign will be used exclusively to cover 50% of the administrative and production costs (travel-artist fees, etc) needed to perform our services.. Through these efforts, we will be effective in educating and motivating, in a positive way, almost 25,000 kids, teachers and parents in the areas of most need.

 

3. Needs Statement

The issues we cover have never been more necessary. Reading levels and literacy rates in today's 1st-6th grade students are way down which leads to drop out rates later on being way up. Our program, "Don't Just Sit There. . Read Something" encourages kids to read more, and thereby, get better grades and do better in school and its also inspires them to become better students and productive citizens.  Also, violence and bullying are real problems at todays schools and we address this issue thoroughly with our Character program, "What Can I Do For You?", with songs about sharing, helping others, self confidence and getting along.  With our Health/Nutrition program, "Don't Just Sit There. . . Get Healthy", in a real FUN, interactive way, we encourage kids to eat the right foods, get plenty of exercise and stay active to avoid the huge increase in obesity in todays youth and we also demonstrate in song effective habits to help kids avoid getting sick. 

Another issue is that  Elementary-Middle school budgets and funding for Youth Organizations like Boys & Girls Clubs, Big Brothers, Big Sisters, and Head Start Centers, have been drastically cut to the point where kids receive very little external, quality Educational programs (assemblies, motivational concerts). By targeting schools, we feel we can maximize the amount of kids we reach and filling the void created by these budget short falls.  

We were are constantly overwhelmed by the amazing reactions from these series of programs where we receive rave reviews like these 3 from teachers who observed our programs:

 

C. D.- Kindergarten Teacher. . . "Once in a while I am overwhelmed by the kindness and goodness others show to their fellow man. I can say that today was one of those days! How impressive that you take the time to share your musical and comedic talents with children! You definitely have a gift and I want you to know how much everyone at our school enjoyed and appreciated your assembly. Some of the comments I heard when we took time to discuss the assembly in class were: 'He was funny', 'I liked the music!', 'The dancing was FUN!', 'It was fun when we screamed!' etc., etc., ALL of the comments were positive!  It was heart warming to look out into the crowd and see all of the children laughing and smiling while they enjoyed the show. I am totally impressed with what you are doing. Thanks again for taking the time to come to our little school."

S.L.- 6th Grade Teacher. . . "I'm the sixth grade teacher. My class really enjoyed your presentation.  Since we don't have a music program at our school anymore (financial reasons), it was nice to have a musical program at our school. I also really liked the way you talked about the importance of reading. Thank you so much."

Middle School Principal (5th grade - 8th). . . "What I liked most about this program was the message of Leadership and that successful people are the ones that "do". I also loved the interaction of the students - they ALL participated in their own way. What I liked least about the programs was that it ended. Next time we'd love to include 9th and maybe 10th graders as well."
story_txt:
1. Organization
Music With A Message For Kids, Inc. is dedicated to bringing FREE educational and motivational music programs to kids in need at Elementary-Middle Schools, Libraries, Youth Organizations, Native American Reservations, and Military bases all over the  U.S.
We are a 501 (c)(3) Non Profit started in 2006 as a response to the need for educational and motivational programs in hurricane damaged New Orleans. We've since been back to that area 4 different times to encourage and motivate kids to get involved in helping their neighbors and in the rebuilding of their Community. In our brief 4 years of existence, we've already provided our service to well over 70,000 kids in 254 Elementary-Middle Schools, Libraries, Youth Organizations and Military Bases in 8 different states, including Michigan, Iowa, Missouri, Illinois, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Wisconsin, and Louisiana. 
 
2. Project Summary
Music With A Message For Kid's purpose in this project is to bring FREE Educational and Motivational music assemblies on Reading/Literacy, Character-anti bullying, and/or Health-Nutrition to inner city kids in at least 80 Elementary Schools in 10 major U.S. cities (Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Detroit, Los Angeles, New York, Phoenix, and San Francisco), over the next 2 school years. The funds from this campaign will be used exclusively to cover 50% of the administrative and production costs (travel-artist fees, etc) needed to perform our services.. Through these efforts, we will be effective in educating and motivating, in a positive way, almost 25,000 kids, teachers and parents in the areas of most need.
 
3. Needs Statement
The issues we cover have never been more necessary. Reading levels and literacy rates in today's 1st-6th grade students are way down which leads to drop out rates later on being way up. Our program, "Don't Just Sit There. . Read Something" encourages kids to read more, and thereby, get better grades and do better in school and its also inspires them to become better students and productive citizens.  Also, violence and bullying are real problems at todays schools and we address this issue thoroughly with our Character program, "What Can I Do For You?", with songs about sharing, helping others, self confidence and getting along.  With our Health/Nutrition program, "Don't Just Sit There. . . Get Healthy", in a real FUN, interactive way, we encourage kids to eat the right foods, get plenty of exercise and stay active to avoid the huge increase in obesity in todays youth and we also demonstrate in song effective habits to help kids avoid getting sick. 
Another issue is that  Elementary-Middle school budgets and funding for Youth Organizations like Boys & Girls Clubs, Big Brothers, Big Sisters, and Head Start Centers, have been drastically cut to the point where kids receive very little external, quality Educational programs (assemblies, motivational concerts). By targeting schools, we feel we can maximize the amount of kids we reach and filling the void created by these budget short falls.  
We were are constantly overwhelmed by the amazing reactions from these series of programs where we receive rave reviews like these 3 from teachers who observed our programs:
 
C. D.- Kindergarten Teacher. . . "Once in a while I am overwhelmed by the kindness and goodness others show to their fellow man. I can say that today was one of those days! How impressive that you take the time to share your musical and comedic talents with children! You definitely have a gift and I want you to know how much everyone at our school enjoyed and appreciated your assembly. Some of the comments I heard when we took time to discuss the assembly in class were: 'He was funny', 'I liked the music!', 'The dancing was FUN!', 'It was fun when we screamed!' etc., etc., ALL of the comments were positive!  It was heart warming to look out into the crowd and see all of the children laughing and smiling while they enjoyed the show. I am totally impressed with what you are doing. Thanks again for taking the time to come to our little school."
S.L.- 6th Grade Teacher. . . "I'm the sixth grade teacher. My class really enjoyed your presentation.  Since we don't have a music program at our school anymore (financial reasons), it was nice to have a musical program at our school. I also really liked the way you talked about the importance of reading. Thank you so much."
Middle School Principal (5th grade - 8th). . . "What I liked most about this program was the message of Leadership and that successful people are the ones that "do". I also loved the interaction of the students - they ALL participated in their own way. What I liked least about the programs was that it ended. Next time we'd love to include 9th and maybe 10th graders as well."

story:
*NOTE* January 22, 2013

 

Wow! Thank you, thank you, thank you! With your donations and some outside donations this is going to happen! I still need to figure out gas money to Nashville, but it's close...

If you missed out the opportunity to help me help the world...you can still donate directly through PayPal to spiritdancercreations@gmail.com or venture over to my blog...http://onajourneybacktoherwings.blogspot.com/ and there is a handy dandy donate button on the right.

 

Thank you so fairy much. I am oozing with gratitude! 

 So very happy.

 Love to you all.

~Amy The Spirit Dancer

*NOTE* January 9, 2013

I have been blessed with outside donations. I was able to register for my Life Coach training! I'm so excited.

With these outside donations, my money goal has now changed.

With this Indiegogo campaign, I need to reach $1000. 

$1000 would cover the rest of my tuition, transportation and food, plus the Indiegogo expenses.

I'm over halfway there!

Can you help me make my dream a reality?

Thank you.

~Amy 

***********************************

 

Amy The Spirit Dancer's Story

Greetings everyone!

I am Amy Riddle. Some folks call me The Spirit Dancer. 

I am a creatress, herbalist, reverend, and muse residing in my hippie-healing dream town, Asheville, NC. I am quite proud of my bachelor's degree in Alternative Medicine from Everglades University and I crave to inspire others to be healthy and whole in body, mind, and spirit. 

Recently I pondered the question:

How can I bring all of my talents together and make them work for me as a career?  

I asked this on top of Max Patch mountain and just a few hours later, I had an epiphany!

Be a Life Coach!

I've always wanted my own business and now my career path is crystal clear.

This is the perfect job for me! 

I've been helping others my whole life. I help friends sort out their junk and start fresh. I help random passerbys by just lending an ear.

Friends, family, and strangers have always come to me for inspiration. 

Now I know this is my calling.

What would make me a fantastic Life Coach? 

  • I have an innate desire to help others. 

  • I make my own flower essences and herbal remedies we could incorporate in the coaching.

  • I create jewelry and candles with spiritual energy. These too, are great tools for manifesting goals. 

  • I listen intuitively and deeply. 

  • I am a believer of manifesting your reality.

  • I walk my talk.

I've been creating my own flower essences, however I plan on gaining certification by taking a Bach Flower essence course. If you aren't familiar with flower essences, check out Rescue Remedy from Bach. It is fantastic for treating stress. Flower essences are made directly from the flowering part of the plant and works energetically on the user. Developed by Dr. Edward Bach, they are great aids in helping mental and emotional aspects of wellness.

I want to dive deeper into the energy of flowers and get certified with Bach Flower Therapy. I feel that flower essences are going to be a huge part of my coaching.

After my epiphany, I began researching schools and training programs for Life Coaching. Most are online or though the telephone. I prefer personal contact. I found a weekend Life Coach training intensive in Nashville, TN. Perfect!

Help me make my dream of being a Life Coach come true. Help me help the world.

 

Transforming My Dream into Reality

How can I make my dream a reality? I have the passion, the drive, the plan...all I need to make it happen is the funds.

The $ Breakdown 

~ Life Coach Training in Nasheville, TN - February 22-24 - $695

(I'm very excited about this program, they go over the theories and fundamentals of life coaching, you get one on one practice, and on the last day you set up a complete marketing plan. They cover everything to get me rolling as a Life Coach.)

~ Hotel Accommodations for Life Coach Training  - $600

~ Transportation and Meals for Life Coach Training  - $385

~ Bach Flower Remedy Certification Course with Bach Flower Essences Kit - $550

~ Indiegogo % - $270

~ Misc/Shipping Costs for Intention Candles/Forgotten Costs/Who knows? - $300

 

And by helping me, you get perks! 

Gifts/Perks/Opportunities 

Depending on which donation amount you choose, depends on which gift and opportunity you receive.

What can you expect? Here are the perks you can attain...

~ Free shipping or coupons for my Spirit Dancer Creations Etsy shop.

http://www.etsy.com/shop/Backtomywings

Keep checking out my shop, I plan on adding new items periodically. 

~ A Spirit Dancer Intention Candle

You could get a Spirit Dancer Intention Candle. My candles are quite unique. They are crafted with recycled wax. Plus I add a bit of magic to them! I'm a Reverend and I bless my candles with energy attuned to the color and scent. Want more passion in your life? You need a red candle!

~ A Year's Worth of Advertising

On my website, I will have a business networking page where I will list your name with a super big Thank You and you have the opportunity to list your business here. Include your website, blog, Facebook page, Pinterest, Etsy shop, and any online link for your business is encouraged. 

Spread the love!

~ Permanent Advertising 

For the larger donations, you will get permanent advertising on my website. Same as the year's worth, only permanent. As long as my website is up, so is ALL of your business information. I want to thank you forever!

~ Life Coaching Sessions

That's why I'm doing this, so who wants some life coaching sessions? Let me inspire you. Let me be your own personal cheerleader. I can help you create goals and attain them. It's my special power. 

 

I want to remain positive and say I will reach my goal...however if I don't quite make it...whatever funds that are raised will go towards the Life Coach training seminar. If I have to take crackers to eat and sleep in my car, I'm going. 

 

Manifestation

With the Life Coaching training in February, I could start accepting clients right after! By April 1st, I should have the website up and all perks promised should be fulfilled.

Help me make my dream a reality. I know that I can empower you to move past your limits. I am excited to help you discover what you want in your life and set your focused goals in to motion. 

I believe I was born to be a Life Coach. It is my special power.

I can coach from anywhere. If you are in the Asheville area, we can get together in person. If not, we can have sessions through skype or telephone. 

Let me inspire you!

I've discovered my calling, let me help you find yours. 

 

How else can you help? So glad you asked!

Please share my campaign, it's super easy. 

Share with the Indiegogo share tools...share on Facebook, Twitter, your personal blog, etc. 

Spread the word. Spread the inspiration!

Help me help the world! 

Thank you, thank you, thank you! And a HUGE THANK YOU to Indiegogo! Because of Indiegogo, people are able to make their dreams a reality. Amazing!

 

May you have a fairy good day!

Peace, Inspiration, and Love,

~Amy Riddle

The Spirit Dancer

story:
Our Story

The Club Sailing Team at Villanova is looking forward to our eighth consecutive year as a member of the Mid-Atlantic Intercollegiate Sailing Association.  We are officially recognized by the University, but as a club team, we only receive a small amount of funding to cover all of our expenses.  On a day to day basis these include yacht club fees, league fees, travel costs and hotels for regatta weekends.  To cover these costs we fundraise and rely heavily on team member dues. 


We have grown in size and skill over the past few years, and with the addition of our new coach, Matt Newborn, we are in the process of raising the competitive level of the team.  We are a team of committed sailors who want to make a name for Villanova Sailing, and the current condition of the team’s sailing facilities and equipment are two major obstacles for us.  We currently practice at Cooper River Yacht Club outside of Camden, NJ.  The Cooper River is manmade and was designed for crew racing.  Even without the constant traffic of high school crew teams, the river itself is not an ideal sailing venue.  The team currently does not own its own boats and leases Cooper River YC’s fleet of Flying Juniors (FJs).  The newest boat is from 1994 and the aging fleet does not facilitate competitive practice.


Our Goal 

Our goal for the immediate future is to move away from Cooper River and transition to practicing out of Corinthian Yacht Club on the Delaware River.  Currently both Drexel University and the University of Pennsylvania already practice at Corinthian and it would benefit all three teams if we were practicing at the same location.  The only way this transition is possible is with a large increase in team finances.  The Corinthian YC dues are significantly higher than Cooper River’s and we would also need to provide our own fleet of boats, a coach boat and dock facilities.  A coach boat will be a huge stepping stone for us.  Our team is already in the midst of the fundraising and logistics involved in this transition, but we are looking for your help to accomplish the next step.


How to Help

Help us raise the $8,000 required to purchase a coach boat and make Corinthian our new home!  The only way this is possible for us is with the help of you!  Your support will have an astounding effect on our team! We would love it if you would join as a contributing member of our team and make our goals our realities. 


All donations to the Villanova Sailing Team are 100% tax deductible. 


Thank you so much for your support!  Please contact us with any questions you may
have at our team email: officers@villanovasailing.com or by contacting our coach, 

Matt Newborn directly at (908)-500-6066.




The Villanova Sailing Team burgee

story:
My name is Jacki Putnam. I am 25 years old. I want to be a filmmaker.

 

I have been trying to finish my education since 2005, but have been forced to put it off for years due to financial limitations. This month I will complete the Photography and Media AAS program at Northern Virginia Community college, as a member of the Phi Theta Kappa honor society with summa cum laude status.

 

I have been accepted into the competitive film program at NYU, but my financial aid and scholarship awards do not cover enough of the cost of attendance for me to be able to afford to attend. My family is unable to provide financial support, and my minimum wage earnings don't even begin to make a dent in the pricetag.

 

In my filmmaking, I am interested in personal struggle, particularly regarding the LGBT community, women, and those struggling from mental illness. It is my ultimate goal to change the way these groups are depicted in the media, and to help to tell their stories.

 

I have a story that needs to be told, and a voice that can make a difference in the world, but I need your help.



What I need, and what you can get:

 

I am trying to raise 20,000 dollars to cover the cost of attendance. All funds raised will be used towards tuition, books and supplies, and room and board.

Perks:

$5- A personal thank you note.

$25- The above, plus a fine art print of one of my photographs, of your choosing.

$50- All of the above, plus a copy of my first completed short film. (currently in preproduction.)

$100- All of the above, plus a spot on my mailing list for six months. You will get a copy of all creative work completed during this time.

$500- All of the above, plus 8 hours of photography or photoshop services.

$1000- All of the above, Plus 12 hours of videography or video editing services.

$5000- All of the above, And I will send you a copy of every creative project completed, for the entirety of my time in school. You will also be credited as an executive producer in any and all personal projects created during this time.

 

Want something else? I'll walk your dog. I'll write you a song. I'll watch your children. I'll bake you cupcakes.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will help me to achieve my dream of completing my undergraduate degree in film. You can change my life and help me to change the lives of others through my creative endeavors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only thing that you can contribute. You can pass the word along, help me to get this mission out in the world.

Anything and everything you can do is appreciated, and I am grateful for any contributions you can make.

story:
Hello-- and HELP!

My name is Kate, representing a group of dedicated and concerned folks working to establish a non-profit organization in order to  secure and restore the Smith Farm (circa 1850) in Middlesex ccounty, NJ. Our eventual goal is to provide educational programming, community garden and farm plots, and to establish an agricultural arts museum. In order to file the paperwork, do the searches and apply for a 501(C)3, we need your help.

A Little Background and Some Plans

The farmstead-- house, out buildings and acres of farmland-- are  township property. Plans to develope a golfcourse a few years ago did not materialize, and since that time the buildings have been vacant. The farm was the Lambertson family homestead for generations, and is a wonderful example of Victorian country Americana. Unfortunately, the  township does not have available funds or manpower to properly restore and maintain the buildings and grounds. An area resident still farms the fields and offers occasional programs to teach  students about agriculture. We hope to help him expand these programs, and institute others, once we achieve non-profit status.

What Your Contributions Will Do

The funds we raise will go first toward filing application for the 501(C)3, with remainder put toward the purchasing of clean up and maintenance supplies, new locks and replacement glass for broken panes once we are approved by the township for this work. Fortunately, we have a talented crew who can do alot and are looking forward to it.  Also, a portion of funds raised will go to the printing of our very special one-of-a-kind perks. The postcards will be copied from the private collections of individuals who have graciously offered to help us out. These are folks genuinely interested in history and truly dedicated to the idea of historical preservation. 

Looking Ahead

Providing we can establish a non-profit organization and be granted permission from the township (which support has been favorable so far.) our ultimate goals include furnishing several rooms in the house to represent a Victorian Farm Home, with space for special displays, and  events including farmer's market, picnics, old time auctions, historic and military reenactments and holiday exhibits. Ambitious goals, certainly, but one which will not only benefit the community, but provide both a source for educational programs and leisure activities. Some of the land can be open for use by garden clubs,which have already expressed an interest, as well as boy and girl scout troops, and  community organizations. School groups and others can learn first hand about farming and if possible, be given plots for their own use. The red barn and other outbuildings will house vintage farm tools and early machinary. We are especially exciited about introducing young people to the history and importance of farmers and farming.

What's In It For You!  

Besides knowing you are helping to rescue a lovely Victorian home, and bringing hands-on farming experience to young folks (and bringing back hopefully happy memories to some of the older ones!)? We have a few perks we hope will inspire you to join us on our mission.

There are special limited edition reproduction Victorian postcards from  private collections, which will be available only through this campaign! Also, a limited number of signed art photographs and prints of natural views and old farmsteads. AND even original artwork--a painting done exclusively for you of the Smith farm.  

Almost Done!  

Most of our group have had several years of experience in historical education, including museum curators, living history reenactors and former and present employees of the National Park Service and other historic sites. We have also received promises of support, donation of materials and 'elbow grease' from local contractors and businesses-- but all of this hinges on the success of our fundraising here.

Please join us in taking this first step towards rescuing the Smith Farm, making agricultural history come alive. Please help spread the word-- and thank you for your kind support!
story_txt:
Hello-- and HELP!
My name is Kate, representing a group of dedicated and concerned folks working to establish a non-profit organization in order to  secure and restore the Smith Farm (circa 1850) in Middlesex ccounty, NJ. Our eventual goal is to provide educational programming, community garden and farm plots, and to establish an agricultural arts museum. In order to file the paperwork, do the searches and apply for a 501(C)3, we need your help.
A Little Background and Some Plans
The farmstead-- house, out buildings and acres of farmland-- are  township property. Plans to develope a golfcourse a few years ago did not materialize, and since that time the buildings have been vacant. The farm was the Lambertson family homestead for generations, and is a wonderful example of Victorian country Americana. Unfortunately, the  township does not have available funds or manpower to properly restore and maintain the buildings and grounds. An area resident still farms the fields and offers occasional programs to teach  students about agriculture. We hope to help him expand these programs, and institute others, once we achieve non-profit status.
What Your Contributions Will Do
The funds we raise will go first toward filing application for the 501(C)3, with remainder put toward the purchasing of clean up and maintenance supplies, new locks and replacement glass for broken panes once we are approved by the township for this work. Fortunately, we have a talented crew who can do alot and are looking forward to it.  Also, a portion of funds raised will go to the printing of our very special one-of-a-kind perks. The postcards will be copied from the private collections of individuals who have graciously offered to help us out. These are folks genuinely interested in history and truly dedicated to the idea of historical preservation. 
Looking Ahead
Providing we can establish a non-profit organization and be granted permission from the township (which support has been favorable so far.) our ultimate goals include furnishing several rooms in the house to represent a Victorian Farm Home, with space for special displays, and  events including farmer's market, picnics, old time auctions, historic and military reenactments and holiday exhibits. Ambitious goals, certainly, but one which will not only benefit the community, but provide both a source for educational programs and leisure activities. Some of the land can be open for use by garden clubs,which have already expressed an interest, as well as boy and girl scout troops, and  community organizations. School groups and others can learn first hand about farming and if possible, be given plots for their own use. The red barn and other outbuildings will house vintage farm tools and early machinary. We are especially exciited about introducing young people to the history and importance of farmers and farming.
What's In It For You!  
Besides knowing you are helping to rescue a lovely Victorian home, and bringing hands-on farming experience to young folks (and bringing back hopefully happy memories to some of the older ones!)? We have a few perks we hope will inspire you to join us on our mission.
There are special limited edition reproduction Victorian postcards from  private collections, which will be available only through this campaign! Also, a limited number of signed art photographs and prints of natural views and old farmsteads. AND even original artwork--a painting done exclusively for you of the Smith farm.  
Almost Done!  
Most of our group have had several years of experience in historical education, including museum curators, living history reenactors and former and present employees of the National Park Service and other historic sites. We have also received promises of support, donation of materials and 'elbow grease' from local contractors and businesses-- but all of this hinges on the success of our fundraising here.
Please join us in taking this first step towards rescuing the Smith Farm, making agricultural history come alive. Please help spread the word-- and thank you for your kind support!

story:
Elements Organizations is the official arrangers of the Annual LGBTQ Womyn of Color Conference that assembles a dynamic group of about 150 - 200 LGBTQ womyn of color between the ages of 16 and 65+ for a three-day weekend of workshops and seminars. This conference serves individuals who self-identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, and trans-gendered womyn of color.  Allies of our community are also welcome to attend. 

This year we have partnered with the Women's Research and Resource Center at Spelman College, the Department of African American Studies, Africana Women's Studies & History (AWH) at Clark Atlanta University and M. PoWeR Productions, LLC to host the conference in Atlanta, GA October 25th-27th.  2013 marks our 5th annual conference which assembles a wonderful variety of about 200 women ranging from ages 16 to 65+ for a weekend of powerful workshops and seminars and fun. The theme of our 5th Annual Conference is Elemental Foundations: Fire, Wind, Earth, Water & You!  We want our community to know the myriad of services available to them and to learn more please visit us on the web for the three day schedule of events and locations at http://www.ourelements.org/  Additionally, Aisha and Danielle Moodie-Mills will deliver the keynote address at our Inter-generational brunch and Dr. Alexis Pauline Gumbs will deliver the closing address and I have attached information about them for your review.

Through this conference, we envision building a group of empowered LGBTQ womyn of color who break silences, become more consciously engaged in one another's herstory and foster connections in order to become a network of resources and support for one another.  This is operationalized through our programming such as our Bridges and Divides Focus Group Series and Winter Hot Chocolate Erotic Art Showcase that aims to keep our core constituency engaged between conferences. We additionally co-sponsor a myriad of projects throughout the LGBTQ community such as the LGBT Kwanzaa Celebration, Black History Month Presentation, Women’s History Month International Women’s Day, GenderReel, Queer Philadelphia Film Festival and Freak ‘n’ Queer Music Festival. 

What We Need & What You Get

Elements needs $5,000+ to fund honoraiums, travel expenses, general operation of overall conference, rental of space, etc. 

-Honoraiums $3,000,

-Travel scholarships $400

-Rental of Space $1500

-General operation $1500

There are perks on the side for those who give monteary donations.

Also as a supporter you get the satisifaction of knowing you did something to help in making a change.

The Impact

  • This is a valuable conference because it is not everyday where one feels comfortable for being who they are. Our organization has changed lives and made points. We have taken stances against violence, abuse, self-pitty, etc, and turned these feelings around for the better in our community.

 

  • Here is a few words from one of our community members,
  • "I was honestly lonely and had some really back self-esteem issues before I found Elements. I am a 35 year old women who recently 'came out' to my family and friends and it was hard, but Elements was there with me every step of the way. These are the type of women that we need conquering society for us." -Tanisha Grant, Phila, PA.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can give monterary donations. However you can also help by spreading the word!!!!!!!!
