story:
Going on an Adventure! I've been Accepted to Naropa University for Somatic Psychology Dance/Movement Therapy Graduate Program. Gonna Change this Planet for the better, one person at a time!

Some of you may know me and others may not.

I'm Ali Landers, A vivacious, loving mom of 2 amazing people, DREAMING BIG, BELIEVING IN CHANGE, TRUSTING & TAKING ACTION!

  My passion and purpose is healing minds, hearts and bodies through Dance & Movement Therapy! I've been making this dream a reality for 4 years now with the intention of becoming a counselor in Somatic Psychology. I want to serve people the best I can and in a way I have experienced great healing myself...through the mode I believe in most, Somatics, the body. Somatic Therapy leading the way in mental health therapy today!

Our bodies speak to us! They are powerful vehicles for healing!! *For more info. on this form of therapy, see Naropa's program at www.naropa.edu

The path is showing up and I'm ready for the next step on this beautiful, passionate journey! The next step is Attending Naropa University, beginning this Fall!!

My story began with Somatic Psychology 9 years ago. I was in the process of divorce and was feeling depressed and lost, not knowing what to do with my life after being a stay at home mom for 10 years.

I had some college under my belt and knew I wanted to pursue my dream of finishing college. I registred for classes at BSU and started on the journey to a BA. I knew I wanted to study psychology and also wanted to explore my love of dance. I decided to take some dance classes. It was hard at first, to go into that dance studio with all those young dancers, and me and old 32. ha.

I loved it!! I had found a part of me, I thought was dead. I had found a new way of healing myself through dance, and moving my body in ways that made me feel alive and whole. I knew I had stumbled upon somehting wonderful...and I was right.

I started to research this phenomenon I had expereinenced, mental health through dance and movement. What I found was surprising and exhilarating! Dancers had been using healing movement for a very long time, even one of Freud's students had studied this modality in the 20's. This form of Therapy was making some headway in the mental health field and it just so happened that I could get a Masters degree in this cutting edge therapy called Somatic Psychology!

That was all I needed to know. I looked up schools offering this degree, chose the one that best fit my beliefs and lifestyle and Naropa University was it!!

It was on! I designed my degree at BSU to fit the criteria for Naropa and worked hard for 2 years to finish with a BA in Psychology w/ a Dance Minor. Having finished that part of my goal. I was on to my main objective, to get accepted into the Somatic Psychology program at Naropa.

Only 25 students are accepted a year. I knew I had a chance with all the activities and education I had experienced. I sent my application and letters off, and it was a waiting game. I finally got an email saying I'd been invited for an inverview! I hopped on a plane in a blizzard, and went to Naropa for a full day of interviews and activities.

The Monday I got back from Boulder, I got a phone call. I had been accepted to The Somatic Psychology Program!!! I had made it in! I was Elated!! Dreams do come true! with determination and hardwork and believing...we can move mountains.

I have made it this far and now am in the process of moving my life to Boulder. It will be no small feat... And I know I have come this far to go all the way.

I will need the support of my family, loved ones and people who know and believe in me!

My daughter and I are taking this journey together. We need your love and support to make this dream possible.

I need to earn $4,000 by Aug. 3 THAT IS ONLY 200 people contributing $20.00!! This is to get Feena and I settled in Boulder. i'll have school funds and a job while i'm there working on my Masters.

I am reaching out to my beloved Community, Family and Friends for assistance.

I wish gas stations took cookies and Landlords accepted dance lessons! Until that time, I need monetary units to get Feena and I set up for a 3 year adventure in Boulder, CO.

I want you all to know, I have every intention to Pay it Forward with my degree in counseling. I'll be returning to Boise throughout my program to hold circles, to teach classes, bring smiles and to love on my community.

PLUS... It is my intention to serve others in need through Women's and Children's programs and being part of bringing awareness and grace to people of all abilities through movement and Dance! To Serve with compassion!

The future is unknown...and, who knows, I may be returning after this journey to contribute to my beloved community in Boise.

Unitl then, have wings... will Fly!

 
I Appreciate any contribution you can make! I will accept it with grace and humility.
 
In Love,
 
Ali Landers

story:
Total Body Fitness

Khadijah has a desire to see anyone who wants to be healthy, achieve their personal goal through proper nutrition, workout techniques and education. She has changed her own health and fitness by research, study and the application of the techniques she has learned.  However, to reach the masses she must be certified. 

Certifications:

  • Personal Training
  • Group Training 
  • Nutritional classes 

Your contributions will make it possible for Khadijah to do all of the following:

  • Have free classes for select groups
  • Empower others who don't have time to research like she did, to reach their fitness and health goals 
  • Empower youth to establish good eating habits early and do exercises that are fun, easy, and life changing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Pass the word on to others by sharing the link to this campaign. 
  • Like her Facebook page and share her posts.  http://www.facebook.com/khadijahrbz
  • Follow her on twitter http://www.twitter.com/Khadijahrbz

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who we are:

We are excited to announce this year’s Fourth Annual Barefoot Benefit 5K and Fall Festival to benefit the Samaritan Place of Knoxville!

The event will take place on October 27th, 2013 at 2pm on the grass of Cherokee Park in The Sequoyah Hills Neighborhood. The Barefoot Benefit is a unique event, organized solely by a group of students from the University of Tennessee’s College of Business.

These students break ties with normal classroom settings, and instead are challenged to create a hands-on learning experience.

The Barefoot Benefit was also the first ever barefoot race and walk, and guided by Dr. Ernie Cadotte, we plan to make this year’s event bigger and better than ever.

Visit Thebarefootbenefit.org or Facebook.com/Barefootbenefit for more info.

 

Why we exist:

Samaritan Place is an organization that provides shelter for very low-income seniors and is one of a very small group of such programs in the United States.  It's the Nation’s only program offering a complete continuum of care, from emergency to long-term housing, for this population. 

Because homelessness issues are different for seniors than for their younger counterparts, Samaritan Place provides not only shelter and nourishment but intensive case management focused on that population’s unique needs.

Samaritan Place, just like us, wouldn't be able to exist without generous donations. We're really passionate about the Barefoot Benefit and we are planning to have the largest number of participants this year due to the change of course location.  Help us help Samaritan Place! 

 


What we need :

Each year our race is funded by generous donations from people and companies in Knoxville and surrounding areas.  We could just send those funds directly to the Samaritan Place, however our goal is to utilize the money and multiply it with The Barefoot Benefit. 

This year we're trying to raise around $5,000 to fund different aspects of the race day such as hiring bands to play, paying for aspects of marketing such as newspaper ads, as well as the equipment used to time our runners.

 

Other ways you can help:

For anyone living in the Knoxville area, visit our web page and sign up to race!  We offer a 5k race, a 1 mile fun-run, as well as a fall festival for the entire family! 

Visit TheBarefootBenefit.org to sign up today!

In addition to participants we are still in need of some volunteers to help the day run as smoothly as possible. You can sign up on our website as well.

Even if you can't sign up to race or help us financially, please like us on at Facebook.com/barefootbenefit or share us on indiegogo using the share tools!

From the 2013 Barefoot Benefit Executive Team,

We thank you!
